data.price: 20. And the Trumpet will be blown - that will be the Day whereof warning (had been given) (i.e. the Day of Resurrection).
data.arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡوَعِيدِ

data.price: 21. And every person will come forth along with an (angel) to drive (him) and an (angel) to bear witness.
data.arabic: وَجَآءَتۡ كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ مَّعَهَا سَآئِقٞ وَشَهِيدٞ

data.price: 22. (It will be said to the sinners): "Indeed you were heedless of this. Now We have removed from you your covering, and sharp is your sight this Day!"
data.arabic: لَّقَدۡ كُنتَ فِي غَفۡلَةٖ مِّنۡ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفۡنَا عَنكَ غِطَآءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ حَدِيدٞ

data.price: 23. And his companion (angel) will say: "Here is (this Record) ready with me!"
data.arabic: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ هَٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ

data.price: 24. (Allah will say to the angels): "Both of you throw into Hell every stubborn disbeliever (in the Oneness of Allâh, in His Messengers).
data.arabic: أَلۡقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٖ

data.price: 25. "Hinderer of good, transgressor, doubter,
data.arabic: مَّنَّاعٖ لِّلۡخَيۡرِ مُعۡتَدٖ مُّرِيبٍ

data.price: 26. "Who set up another ilâh (god) with Allâh. Then both of you cast him in the severe torment."
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَأَلۡقِيَاهُ فِي ٱلۡعَذَابِ ٱلشَّدِيدِ

data.price: 27. His companion (Satan - devil)] will say: "Our Lord! I did not push him to transgression, (in disbelief, oppression, and evil deeds) but he was himself in error far astray."
data.arabic: ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ رَبَّنَا مَآ أَطۡغَيۡتُهُۥ وَلَٰكِن كَانَ فِي ضَلَٰلِۭ بَعِيدٖ

data.price: 28. Allâh will say: "Dispute not in front of Me, I had already in advance sent you the threat.
data.arabic: قَالَ لَا تَخۡتَصِمُواْ لَدَيَّ وَقَدۡ قَدَّمۡتُ إِلَيۡكُم بِٱلۡوَعِيدِ

data.price: 29. The Sentence that comes from Me cannot be changed, and I am not unjust to the slaves."
data.arabic: مَا يُبَدَّلُ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِظَلَّٰمٖ لِّلۡعَبِيدِ

data.price: 30. On the Day when We will say to Hell: "Are you filled?" It will say: "Are there any more (to come)?"[4]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ ٱمۡتَلَأۡتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلۡ مِن مَّزِيدٖ
data.footnotes:
(V.50:30) Allah’s Statement: "It (Hell) will say: ‘Are there any more (to come)?’"
Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The people will be thrown into the (Hell) Fire and it will say: ‘Are there any more (to come)?’ till Allah will put His Foot over it and it will say: ‘Qat ! Qat ! (Enough! Enough!)’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadîth No.371).

data.price: 31. And Paradise will be brought near to the Muttaqûn (the pious. See V.2:2), not far off.
data.arabic: وَأُزۡلِفَتِ ٱلۡجَنَّةُ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ غَيۡرَ بَعِيدٍ

data.price: 32. (It will be said): "This is what you were promised - (it is) for those oft-returning (to Allâh) in sincere repentance, and those who preserve their covenant with Allâh (by obeying Him in all what He has ordered, and worshipping none but Allâh Alone, i.e. follow Allâh’s religion - Islâmic Monotheism).
data.arabic: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٖ

data.price: 33. "Who feared the Most Gracious (Allâh) in the Ghaib (Unseen) and brought a heart turned in repentance (to Him and absolutely free from each and every kind of polytheism).
data.arabic: مَّنۡ خَشِيَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنَ بِٱلۡغَيۡبِ وَجَآءَ بِقَلۡبٖ مُّنِيبٍ

data.price: 34. "Enter you therein in peace and security - this is a Day of eternal life!"
data.arabic: ٱدۡخُلُوهَا بِسَلَٰمٖۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡخُلُودِ

data.price: 35. There they will have all that they desire - and We have more (for them, i.e. a glance at the All-Mighty, All-Majestic جل جلاله).
data.arabic: لَهُم مَّا يَشَآءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيۡنَا مَزِيدٞ

data.price: 36. And how many a generation We have destroyed before them who were stronger in power than they. And (when Our Torment came), they ran for a refuge in the land! Could they find any place of refuge (for them to save themselves from destruction)?
data.arabic: وَكَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا قَبۡلَهُم مِّن قَرۡنٍ هُمۡ أَشَدُّ مِنۡهُم بَطۡشٗا فَنَقَّبُواْ فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ هَلۡ مِن مَّحِيصٍ

data.price: 37. Verily, therein is indeed a reminder for him who has a heart or gives ear while he is heedful.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكۡرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُۥ قَلۡبٌ أَوۡ أَلۡقَى ٱلسَّمۡعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٞ

data.price: 38. And indeed We created the heavens and the earth and all between them in six Days and nothing of fatigue touched Us.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٖ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٖ

data.price: 39. So bear with patience (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) all that they say, and glorify the Praises of your Lord, before the rising of the sun and before (its) setting (i.e. the Fajr, Zuhr, and ‘Asr prayers)[1].
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ قَبۡلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمۡسِ وَقَبۡلَ ٱلۡغُرُوبِ
data.footnotes:
(V.50:39).
a) Narrated Qais: Jarîr said, "We were with the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم and he looked at the moon on a full-moon night and said: ‘Certainly you will see your Lord as you see this moon and you will have no trouble in seeing Him. So if you can avoid missing (through sleep or business) a prayer before the sunrise (Fajr) and a prayer before sunset (‘Asr ), you must do so’. ‘He then recited Allah’s Statement:
"And glorify the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun, and before (its) setting." (V.50:39).
Ismâ‘îl said: "Offer those prayers and do not miss them." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadîth No.529)
b) See the footnote of (V.32:16).

data.price: 40. And during a part of the night (also) glorify His praises (i.e. Maghrib and ‘Isha prayers) and (so likewise) after the prayers [As-Sunnah, Nawâfil - optional and additional prayers. And also glorify, praise and magnify Allâh - Subhân Allâh, Alhamdu lillâh, Allâhu-Akbar].
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَأَدۡبَٰرَ ٱلسُّجُودِ

data.price: 41. And listen on the Day when the caller will call from a near place.
data.arabic: وَٱسۡتَمِعۡ يَوۡمَ يُنَادِ ٱلۡمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٖ قَرِيبٖ

data.price: 42. The Day when they will hear As-Saihah (shout) in truth: that will be the Day of coming out (from the graves, i.e. the Day of Resurrection).
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَسۡمَعُونَ ٱلصَّيۡحَةَ بِٱلۡحَقِّۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡخُرُوجِ

data.price: 43. Verily, We it is Who give life and cause death; and to Us is the final return.
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نُحۡيِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيۡنَا ٱلۡمَصِيرُ

data.price: 44. On the Day when the earth shall be cleft, from off them, (they will come out) hastening forth. That will be a gathering, quite easy for Us.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ عَنۡهُمۡ سِرَاعٗاۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشۡرٌ عَلَيۡنَا يَسِيرٞ

data.price: 45. We know best what they say. And you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) are not the one to force them (to Belief). But warn by the Qur’an; him who fears My Threat.
data.arabic: نَّحۡنُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ عَلَيۡهِم بِجَبَّارٖۖ فَذَكِّرۡ بِٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ

data.price: 1. By (the winds) that scatter dust.
data.arabic: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَٰتِ ذَرۡوٗا

data.price: 2. And (the clouds) that bear heavy weight of water.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡحَٰمِلَٰتِ وِقۡرٗا

data.price: 3. And (the ships) that float with ease and gentleness.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡجَٰرِيَٰتِ يُسۡرٗا

data.price: 4. And those (angels) who distribute (provisions, rain, and other blessings) by (Allâh’s) Command.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُقَسِّمَٰتِ أَمۡرًا

data.price: 5. Verily, that which you are promised (i.e. Resurrection in the Hereafter and receiving the reward or punishment of good or bad deeds) is surely true.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٞ

data.price: 6. And verily, the Recompense is sure to happen.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٞ

data.price: 7. By the heaven full of paths,
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡحُبُكِ

data.price: 8. Certainly, you have different ideas (about Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم and the Qur’ân).
data.arabic: إِنَّكُمۡ لَفِي قَوۡلٖ مُّخۡتَلِفٖ

data.price: 9. Turned aside therefrom (i.e. from Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم and the Qur’ân) is he who is turned aside (by the Decree and Preordainment القضاء والقدر of Allâh).
data.arabic: يُؤۡفَكُ عَنۡهُ مَنۡ أُفِكَ

data.price: 10. Cursed be the liars
data.arabic: قُتِلَ ٱلۡخَرَّٰصُونَ

data.price: 11. Who are under a cover of heedlessness (think not about the gravity of the Hereafter),
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي غَمۡرَةٖ سَاهُونَ

data.price: 12. They ask: "When will be the Day of Recompense?"
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 13. (It will be) a Day when they will be tried (punished i.e. burnt) over the Fire!
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ هُمۡ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفۡتَنُونَ

data.price: 14. "Taste you your trial (punishment i.e. burning)! This is what you used to ask to be hastened!"
data.arabic: ذُوقُواْ فِتۡنَتَكُمۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ

data.price: 15. Verily, the Muttaqûn (the pious. See V.2:2) will be in the midst of Gardens and Springs (in the Paradise),
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ

data.price: 16. Taking joy in the things which their Lord has given them. Verily, they were before this Muhsinûn (good-doers. See V.2:112).
data.arabic: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: 17. They used to sleep but little by night [invoking their Lord (Allâh) and praying, with fear and hope].
data.arabic: كَانُواْ قَلِيلٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ مَا يَهۡجَعُونَ

data.price: 18. And in the hours before dawn, they were (found) asking (Allâh) for forgiveness.
data.arabic: وَبِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ هُمۡ يَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ

data.price: 19. And in their properties there was the right of the Sâ’il (the beggar who asks) and the Mahrûm (the poor who does not ask others)[1].
data.arabic: وَفِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ
data.footnotes: (V.51:19) See the footnote of (V.4:37).

data.price: 20. And on the earth are signs for those who have Faith with certainty.
data.arabic: وَفِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ءَايَٰتٞ لِّلۡمُوقِنِينَ

data.price: 21. And also in your ownselves. Will you not then see?
data.arabic: وَفِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: 22. And in the heaven is your provision, and that which you are promised.
data.arabic: وَفِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزۡقُكُمۡ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ

data.price: 23. Then by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is the truth (i.e. what has been promised to you), just as it is the truth that you can speak.
data.arabic: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقّٞ مِّثۡلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمۡ تَنطِقُونَ

data.price: 24. Has the story reached you, of the honoured guests [three angels; Jibrîl (Gabriel) along with another two] of Ibrâhîm (Abraham)?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِينَ

data.price: 25. When they came in to him and said: "Salâm, (peace be upon you)!" He answered: "Salâm, (peace be upon you)," and said: "You are a people unknown to me."
data.arabic: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗاۖ قَالَ سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ

data.price: 26. Then he turned to his household, and brought out a roasted calf [as the property of Ibrâhîm (Abraham) was mainly cows].
data.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجۡلٖ سَمِينٖ

data.price: 27. And placed it before them, (saying): "Will you not eat?"
data.arabic: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ

data.price: 28. Then he conceived fear of them (when they ate not). They said: "Fear not."[2] And they gave him glad tidings of a son having knowledge (about Allâh and His religion of True Monotheism).
data.arabic: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِيفَةٗۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
data.footnotes: (V.51:28) i.e. when the angels noticed some fear over the face of Abraham, they told him that they are Allâh’s messengers. And they also gave the glad news to his wife Sarah that she will give birth to a son (Isaac).

data.price: 29. Then his wife came forward with a loud voice: she smote her face, and said: "A barren old woman!"[3]
data.arabic: فَأَقۡبَلَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ فِي صَرَّةٖ فَصَكَّتۡ وَجۡهَهَا وَقَالَتۡ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٞ
data.footnotes: (V.51:29) "How can I bear a child." At that time she (Sarah) was approximately 99 years old. (Tafsîr Al-Qurtubi ).

data.price: 30. They said: "Even so says your Lord.[4] Verily, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knower."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
data.footnotes:
(V.51:30)
a) The Statement of Allâh عز وجل:
‘Verily, Our Word (Command) unto a thing, when We intend it, is only that We say unto it:
"Be!" - and it is.’ (V.16:40)
Narrated Mu‘âwiyah رضي الله عنه: I heard the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم saying, "A group of my followers will keep on following Allâh’s Orders [i.e., following strictly Allâh’s Book (the Qur’ân) and the Prophet’s Sunnah (legal ways)] strictly and they will not be harmed by those who will belie (disbelieve) them or desert (stand against) them till Allâh’s Order (the Hour) will come while they will be in that state." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.9, Hadith No.552).
b) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Allâh said, ‘I have prepared for My pious slaves things which have never been seen by an eye, nor heard by an ear, or (even) imagined by a human being.’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadith No. 467)
c) Narrated Abû Sa‘îd Al-Khudrî رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The people of Paradise will look at the dwellers of Al-Ghuraf (the lofty mansions i.e. a superior place in Paradise) in the same way as one looks at a brilliant star far away in the east or in the west on the horizon; all that is because of their superiority over one another (in rewards)." On that the people said, "O Allâh’s Messenger! Are these residences (lofty mansions) for the Prophets which nobody else can reach?" The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم replied, "No! By Him (Allah) in Whose Hand my soul is, these are for the men who believed in Allah and also believed in the Messengers." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadith No. 478)
d) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The first batch (of people) who will enter Paradise will be (glittering) like the moon on a full-moon night and those who will enter next will be glittering like the brightest star. Their hearts will be as if the heart of a single man for they will have neither difference nor any enmity amongst themselves, and everyone of them shall have two wives, each of whom will be so beautiful, pure and transparent that the marrow of the bones of their legs will be seen through the flesh. They will be glorifying Allâh in the morning and afternoon, and will never fall ill, and they will neither blow their noses nor spit. Their utensils will be of gold and silver, and their combs will be of gold and the fuel used in their censers will be of aloes-wood and their sweat will smell like musk." ... (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadith No. 469).

data.price: 31. [Ibrâhîm (Abraham)] said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O Messengers?"
data.arabic: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ

data.price: 32. They said: "We have been sent to a people who are Mujrimûn (polytheists, sinners, criminals, disbelievers in Allâh)
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: 33. To send down upon them stones of baked clay.
data.arabic: لِنُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن طِينٖ

data.price: 34. Marked by your Lord for the Musrifûn (polytheists, criminals, sinners - those who trespass Allâh’s set limits in evil-doings by committing great sins).
data.arabic: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ

data.price: 35. So We brought out from therein the believers.
data.arabic: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: 36. But We found not there any household of the Muslims except one [of Lût (Lot) and his two daughters].
data.arabic: فَمَا وَجَدۡنَا فِيهَا غَيۡرَ بَيۡتٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ

data.price: 37. And We have left there a sign (i.e. the place of the Dead Sea[1] in Palestine) for those who fear the painful torment.
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
data.footnotes: (V.51:37) See the book of history "The Stories of the Prophets." by Ibn Kathir رحمه الله.

data.price: 38. And in Mûsâ (Moses) (too, there is a sign), when We sent him to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) with a manifest authority.
data.arabic: وَفِي مُوسَىٰٓ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: 39. But [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] turned away (from Belief in might) along with his hosts, and said: "A sorcerer, or a madman."
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكۡنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَٰحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٞ

data.price: 40. So We took him and his hosts, and dumped them into the sea, for he was blameworthy.
data.arabic: فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ

data.price: 41. And in ‘Âd (there is also a sign) when We sent against them the barren wind;
data.arabic: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلۡعَقِيمَ

data.price: 42. It spared nothing that it reached, but blew it into broken spreads of rotten ruins.
data.arabic: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيۡءٍ أَتَتۡ عَلَيۡهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتۡهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ

data.price: 43. And in Thamûd (there is also a sign), when they were told: "Enjoy yourselves for a while!"
data.arabic: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذۡ قِيلَ لَهُمۡ تَمَتَّعُواْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: 44. But they insolently defied the Command of their Lord, so the Sâ‘iqah[2] overtook them while they were looking.
data.arabic: فَعَتَوۡاْ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّٰعِقَةُ وَهُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
data.footnotes: (V.51:44) Sâ‘iqah: A destructive awful cry, torment, hit, a thunderbolt, See (V.41:13).

data.price: 45. Then they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves.
data.arabic: فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مِن قِيَامٖ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُنتَصِرِينَ

data.price: 46. (So were) the people of Nûh (Noah) before them. Verily, they were a people who were Fâsiqûn (rebellious, disobedient to Allâh).
data.arabic: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا فَٰسِقِينَ

data.price: 47. With power did We construct the heaven. Verily, We are Able to extend the vastness of space thereof.
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيۡنَٰهَا بِأَيۡيْدٖ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ

data.price: 48. And We have spread out the earth: how Excellent Spreader (thereof) are We!
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَرَشۡنَٰهَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمَٰهِدُونَ

data.price: 49. And of everything We have created pairs, that you may remember (the Grace of Allâh).
data.arabic: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَا زَوۡجَيۡنِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَذَكَّرُونَ

data.price: 50. So flee to Allâh (from His Torment to His Mercy - Islâmic Monotheism). Verily, I (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) am a plain warner to you from Him.[3]
data.arabic: فَفِرُّوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
data.footnotes: (V.51:50) See the footnote of (V.3:85).

data.price: 51. And set not up (or worship not) any other ilâh (god) along with Allâh [Glorified be He (Alone), Exalted above all that they associate as partners with Him]. Verily, I (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) am a plain warner to you from Him.
data.arabic: وَلَا تَجۡعَلُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: 52. Likewise, no Messenger came to those before them but they said: "A sorcerer or a madman!"
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُواْ سَاحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٌ

data.price: 53. Have they (the people of the past) transmitted this saying to these (Quraish pagans)? Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds (in disbelief)!
data.arabic: أَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِهِۦۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ

data.price: 54. So turn away (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) from them (Quraish pagans), you are not blame-worthy (as you have conveyed Allâh’s Message).
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٖ

data.price: 55. And remind (by preaching the Qur’ân, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), for verily, the reminding profits the believers.
data.arabic: وَذَكِّرۡ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: 56. And I (Allâh) created not the jinn and mankind except that they should worship Me (Alone).
data.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقۡتُ ٱلۡجِنَّ وَٱلۡإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُونِ

data.price: 57. I seek not any provision from them (i.e. provision for themselves or for My creatures) nor do I ask that they should feed Me (i.e. feed themselves or My creatures).
data.arabic: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنۡهُم مِّن رِّزۡقٖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطۡعِمُونِ

data.price: 58. Verily, Allâh is the All-Provider, Owner of Power, the Most Strong.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلۡقُوَّةِ ٱلۡمَتِينُ

data.price: 59. And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a portion of torment like to the evil portion of torment (which came for) their likes (of old); so let them not ask Me to hasten on!
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ ذَنُوبٗا مِّثۡلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصۡحَٰبِهِمۡ فَلَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ

data.price: 60. Then woe to those who disbelieve (in Allâh and His Oneness - Islâmic Monotheism) from their Day which they have been promised (for their punishment).[1]
data.arabic: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن يَوۡمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
data.footnotes:
(V.51:60)
A) See the footnote of (V.3:85).
B) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Allâh will say to the person of the (Hell) Fire who will receive the least punishment, ‘If you had everything on the earth, would you give it as a ransom to free yourself (i.e., save yourself from this Fire)?" He will say, ‘Yes.’ Then Allâh will say, ‘While you were in the backbone of Adam, I asked you much less than this, (i.e., not to worship others besides Me), but you insisted on worshipping others besides me.’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadith No.551).

data.price: 1. By the Tûr (Mount)
data.arabic: وَٱلطُّورِ

data.price: 2. And by a Book Inscribed
data.arabic: وَكِتَٰبٖ مَّسۡطُورٖ

data.price: 3. In parchment unrolled.
data.arabic: فِي رَقّٖ مَّنشُورٖ

data.price: 4. And by Al-Bait-ul-Ma‘mûr[2] (the house over the heavens parallel to the Ka‘bah at Makkah, continuously visited by the angels).
data.arabic: وَٱلۡبَيۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡمُورِ
data.footnotes: (V.52:4) See the footnote of (V.53:12).

data.price: 5. And by the roof raised high (i.e. the heaven).
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّقۡفِ ٱلۡمَرۡفُوعِ

data.price: 6. And by the sea kept filled (or it will be fire kindled on the Day of Resurrection).
data.arabic: وَٱلۡبَحۡرِ ٱلۡمَسۡجُورِ

data.price: 7. Verily, the Torment of your Lord will surely come to pass.
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَٰقِعٞ

data.price: 8. There is none that can avert it.
data.arabic: مَّا لَهُۥ مِن دَافِعٖ

data.price: 9. On the Day when the heaven will shake with a dreadful shaking,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَمُورُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ مَوۡرٗا

data.price: 10. And the mountains will move away with a (horrible) movement.
data.arabic: وَتَسِيرُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ سَيۡرٗا

data.price: 11. Then woe that Day to the beliers.[3]
data.arabic: فَوَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
data.footnotes: (V.52:11) See the footnote of (V.17:97).

data.price: 12. Who are playing in falsehood[4].
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي خَوۡضٖ يَلۡعَبُونَ
data.footnotes: (V.52:12) Busy in disbelief and evil deeds in this world, that are trials (for mankind), and they are ignoring their eternal end (i.e. punishment in the Fire of Hell, forever).

data.price: 13. The Day when they will be pushed down by force to the Fire of Hell, with a horrible, forceful pushing.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا

data.price: 14. This is the Fire which you used to belie.
data.arabic: هَٰذِهِ ٱلنَّارُ ٱلَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: 15. Is this magic, or do you not see?
data.arabic: أَفَسِحۡرٌ هَٰذَآ أَمۡ أَنتُمۡ لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: 16. Taste you therein its heat and whether you are patient of it or impatient of it, it is all the same. You are only being requited for what you used to do.
data.arabic: ٱصۡلَوۡهَا فَٱصۡبِرُوٓاْ أَوۡ لَا تَصۡبِرُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ إِنَّمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: 17. Verily, the Muttaqûn (the pious. See V.2:2) will be in Gardens (Paradise), and Delight.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَعِيمٖ

data.price: 18. Enjoying in that which their Lord has bestowed on them, and (the fact that) their Lord saved them from the torment of the blazing Fire.
data.arabic: فَٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ وَوَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: 19. "Eat and drink with happiness because of what you used to do."
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: 20. They will recline (with ease) on thrones arranged in ranks. And We shall marry them to Hûr: (female, fair ones) with wide lovely eyes.[1]
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّصۡفُوفَةٖۖ وَزَوَّجۡنَٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٖ
data.footnotes: (V.52:20) Hûr. Very fair females created by Allah as such, not from the offspring of Adam عليه السلام with intense black irises of their eyes and intense white scleras. See the footnote of (V.44:54)

data.price: 21. And those who believe and whose offspring follow them in Faith: to them shall We join their offspring, and We shall not decrease the reward of their deeds in anything. Every person is a pledge for that which he has earned.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَٱتَّبَعَتۡهُمۡ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَٰنٍ أَلۡحَقۡنَا بِهِمۡ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمۡ وَمَآ أَلَتۡنَٰهُم مِّنۡ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيۡءٖۚ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيِٕۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٞ

data.price: 22. And We shall provide them with fruit and meat such as they desire.
data.arabic: وَأَمۡدَدۡنَٰهُم بِفَٰكِهَةٖ وَلَحۡمٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ

data.price: 23. There they shall pass from hand to hand a (wine) cup, free from any Laghw (dirty, false, evil vain talk between them), and free from sin[2] (because it will be lawful for them to drink).
data.arabic: يَتَنَٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا لَّا لَغۡوٞ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمٞ
data.footnotes: (V.52:23) See Footnote b, c and d of (V.2:219).

data.price: 24. And there will go round boy-servants of theirs, to serve them as if they were preserved pearls.
data.arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ غِلۡمَانٞ لَّهُمۡ كَأَنَّهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٞ مَّكۡنُونٞ

data.price: 25. And some of them draw near to others, questioning.
data.arabic: وَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: 26. Saying: "Aforetime, we were afraid (of the punishment of Allâh) in the midst of our families.
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبۡلُ فِيٓ أَهۡلِنَا مُشۡفِقِينَ

data.price: 27. "So Allâh has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of the Fire.
data.arabic: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ

data.price: 28. "Verily, We used to invoke Him (Alone and none else) before. Verily, He is Al-Barr (the Most Subtle, Kind, Courteous, and Generous), the Most Merciful."[3]
data.arabic: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبۡلُ نَدۡعُوهُۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
data.footnotes: (V.52:28) See the footnote of (V.2:165).

data.price: 29. Therefore, remind (mankind of Islâmic Monotheism, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم). By the Grace of Allâh, you are neither a soothsayer, nor a madman.
data.arabic: فَذَكِّرۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِنِعۡمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٖ وَلَا مَجۡنُونٍ

data.price: 30. Or do they say: "(Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is a poet! We await for him some calamity by time!"
data.arabic: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٞ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيۡبَ ٱلۡمَنُونِ

data.price: 31. Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم to them): "Wait! I am with you among the waiters!"
data.arabic: قُلۡ تَرَبَّصُواْ فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡمُتَرَبِّصِينَ

data.price: 32. Do their minds command them this [i.e. to tell a lie against you (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)] or are they people transgressing all bounds?
data.arabic: أَمۡ تَأۡمُرُهُمۡ أَحۡلَٰمُهُم بِهَٰذَآۚ أَمۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ

data.price: 33. Or do they say: "He (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has forged it (this Qur’ân)?" Nay! They believe not!
data.arabic: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥۚ بَل لَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: 34. Let them then produce a recital like unto it (the Qur’ân) if they are truthful.
data.arabic: فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِحَدِيثٖ مِّثۡلِهِۦٓ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ

data.price: 35. Were they created by nothing? Or were they themselves the creators?
data.arabic: أَمۡ خُلِقُواْ مِنۡ غَيۡرِ شَيۡءٍ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ

data.price: 36. Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they have no firm Belief.
data.arabic: أَمۡ خَلَقُواْ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ

data.price: 37. Or are with them the treasures of your Lord? Or are they the tyrants with the authority to do as they like?
data.arabic: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَآئِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡمُصَۜيۡطِرُونَ

data.price: 38. Or have they a stairway (to heaven), by means of which they listen (to the talks of the angels)? Then let their listener produce some manifest proof.
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ سُلَّمٞ يَسۡتَمِعُونَ فِيهِۖ فَلۡيَأۡتِ مُسۡتَمِعُهُم بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٍ

data.price: 39. Or has He (Allâh) only daughters and you have sons?
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُ ٱلۡبَنَٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلۡبَنُونَ

data.price: 40. Or is it that you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) ask a wage from them (for your preaching of Islâmic Monotheism) so that they are burdened with a load of debt?
data.arabic: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ

data.price: 41. Or that the Ghaib (Unseen) is with them, and they write it down?
data.arabic: أَمۡ عِندَهُمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبُ فَهُمۡ يَكۡتُبُونَ

data.price: 42. Or do they intend a plot (against you O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)? But those who disbelieve (in the Oneness of Allâh - Islâmic Monotheism) are themselves plotted against!
data.arabic: أَمۡ يُرِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗاۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡمَكِيدُونَ

data.price: 43. Or have they an ilâh (a god) other than Allâh? Glorified be Allâh from all that they ascribe as partners (to Him)[1]
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ إِلَٰهٌ غَيۡرُ ٱللَّهِۚ سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشۡرِكُونَ
data.footnotes:
(V.52:43)
a) See the footnote (B) of (V.3:130).
b) See the footnote of (V.2:278)

data.price: 44. And if they were to see a piece of the heaven falling down, they would say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"
data.arabic: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ كِسۡفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطٗا يَقُولُواْ سَحَابٞ مَّرۡكُومٞ

data.price: 45. So leave them alone till they meet their Day, in which they will sink into a fainting (with horror).
data.arabic: فَذَرۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي فِيهِ يُصۡعَقُونَ

data.price: 46. The Day when their plotting shall not avail them at all nor will they be helped (i.e. they will receive their torment in Hell).
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ لَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُمۡ كَيۡدُهُمۡ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا هُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ

data.price: 47. And verily, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment (i.e. the torment in this world and in their graves)[2] before this; but most of them know not. (Tafsir At-Tabarî).
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ عَذَابٗا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَهُمۡ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: (V.52:47) See the footnote (B) of (V.6:93).

data.price: 48. So wait patiently (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) for the Decision of your Lord, for verily, you are under Our Eyes[3]; and glorify the Praises of your Lord when you get up from sleep.
data.arabic: وَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعۡيُنِنَاۖ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
data.footnotes: (V.52:48) See the footnote of (V.3:73).

data.price: 49. And in the nighttime also glorify His Praises - and at the setting of the stars.[4]
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَإِدۡبَٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ
data.footnotes: (V.52:49) It is said that glorifying Allâh’s Praises here means: all the five compulsory and additional Nawâfil prayers.

data.price: 1. By the star when it goes down (or vanishes).
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّجۡمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ

data.price: 2. Your companion (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has neither gone astray nor has erred.
data.arabic: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمۡ وَمَا غَوَىٰ

data.price: 3. Nor does he speak of (his own) desire.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَنطِقُ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰٓ

data.price: 4. It is only a Revelation revealed.
data.arabic: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحۡيٞ يُوحَىٰ

data.price: 5. He has been taught (this Qur’ân) by one mighty in power [Jibrîl (Gabriel)]
data.arabic: عَلَّمَهُۥ شَدِيدُ ٱلۡقُوَىٰ

data.price: 6. One free from any defect in body and mind then he (Jibrîl - Gabriel in his real shape as created by Allah) rose and became stable.
data.arabic: ذُو مِرَّةٖ فَٱسۡتَوَىٰ

data.price: 7. While he [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] was in the highest part of the horizon, (Tafsir Ibn Kathir)
data.arabic: وَهُوَ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

data.price: 8. Then he [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] approached and came closer,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ

data.price: 9. And was at a distance of two bows’ length or (even) nearer.
data.arabic: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوۡسَيۡنِ أَوۡ أَدۡنَىٰ

data.price: 10. So (Allâh) revealed to His slave [Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم through Jibrîl (Gabriel) عليه السلام] whatever He revealed.
data.arabic: فَأَوۡحَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ عَبۡدِهِۦ مَآ أَوۡحَىٰ

data.price: 11. The (Prophet’s) heart lied not in what he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) saw.
data.arabic: مَا كَذَبَ ٱلۡفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰٓ

data.price: 12. Will you then dispute with him (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) about what he saw [during the Mi‘râj: (Ascent of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم to the seven heavens)][1]
data.arabic: أَفَتُمَٰرُونَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ
data.footnotes:
(V.53:12) Al-Mi‘râj (i.e. Ascent of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم to the heavens with his body and soul (بالروح والجسد).
Narrated Mâlik bin Sa‘sa‘ah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "While I was at the house in a state midway between sleep and wakefulness, (an angel recognized me) as the man lying between two men. A golden tray full of wisdom and belief was brought to me and my body was cut open from the throat to the lower part of the abdomen and then my abdomen was washed with Zamzam water and (my heart was) filled with wisdom and belief. Al-Burâq, a white animal smaller than a mule and bigger than a donkey was brought to me and I set out with Jibrîl (Gabriel). When I reached the nearest heaven, Jibrîl said to the gate-keeper of the heaven, ‘Open the gate.’ The gate-keeper asked, ‘Who is it?’ He said, ‘Jibrîl.’ The gate-keeper, said ‘Who is accompanying you?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم’. The gate-keeper said, ‘Has he been called?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Yes’. Then it was said, ‘He is welcome. What a wonderful visit his is!’ Then I met Adam and greeted him and he said, ‘You are welcome O son and a Prophet.’ Then we ascended to the second heaven. It was asked, ‘Who is it?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Jibrîl.’ It was said, ‘Who is with you?’ He said, ‘Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم’. It was asked, ‘Has he been sent for?’ He said, ‘Yes.’ It was said, ‘He is welcome. What a wonderful visit his is.’ Then I met ‘Îsâ (Jesus) and Yahyâ (John) who said, ‘You are welcome, O brother and a Prophet.’ Then we ascended to the third heaven. It was asked, ‘Who is it?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Jibrîl.’ It was asked, ‘Who is with you?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم’. It was asked, ‘Has he been sent for?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Yes.’ It was said ‘He is welcome. What a wonderful visit his is!’ (The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم added:). There I met Yûsuf (Joseph) and greeted him, and he replied, ‘You are welcome, O brother and a Prophet!’ Then we ascended to the fourth heaven and again the same questions and answers were exchanged as in the previous heavens. There I met Idrîs (Enoch) and greeted him. He said, ‘You are welcome O brother and Prophet.’ Then we ascended to the fifth heaven and again the same questions and answers were exchanged as in the previous heavens. There I met and greeted Hârûn (Aaron) who said, ‘You are welcome, O brother and a Prophet.’ Then we ascended to the sixth heaven and again the same questions and answers were exchanged as in the previous heavens. There I met and greeted Mûsâ (Moses) who said, ‘You are welcome, O brother and a Prophet.’ When I proceeded on, he started weeping and on being asked why he was weeping, he said, ‘O Lord! followers of this youth who was sent after me will enter Paradise in greater number than my followers.’ Then we ascended to the seventh heaven and again the same questions and answers were exchanged as in the previous heavens. There I met and greeted Abraham who said, ‘You are welcome, O son and a Prophet.’ Then I was shown Al-Bait Al-Ma‘mûr (i.e. Allah’s House). I asked Jibrîl about it and he said, ‘This is Al-Bait Al-Ma‘mûr where 70,000 angels perform prayers daily; and when they leave they never return to it (but always a fresh batch comes into it daily).’ Then I was shown Sidrat-ul Muntaha (i.e. the lote-tree of the utmost boundary over the seventh heaven) and I saw its Nabiq fruits which resembled the clay jugs of Hajar (a town in Arabia), and its leaves were like the ears of elephants, and four rivers originated at its root: two of them were apparent and two were hidden. I asked Jibrîl about those rivers and he said, ‘The two hidden rivers are in Paradise and the apparent ones are the Nile and the Euphrates.’ Then fifty prayers were enjoined on me. I descended till I met Mûsâ who asked me, ‘What have you done?’ I said, ‘Fifty prayers have been enjoined on me.’ He said, ‘I know the people better than you, because I had the hardest experience to bring Banî Israel to obedience. Your followers cannot put up with such obligation. So, return to your Lord and request Him (to reduce the number of prayers).’ I returned and requested Allah (for reduction) and He made it forty. I returned and [met Mûsâ] and had a similar discussion, and then returned again to Allah for reduction and He made it thirty, then twenty, then ten; and then I came to Mûsâ! who repeated the same advice. Ultimately Allah reduced it to five. When I came to Mûsâ again, he said, ‘What have you done?’ I said, ‘Allah has made it five only.’ He repeated the same advice but I said that I surrendered (to Allah’s Final Order)" Allah’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم was addressed by Allah, "I have decreed My Obligation and have reduced the burden on My slaves, and I shall reward a single good deed as if it were ten good deeds." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadîth No.429).

data.price: 13. And indeed he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) saw him [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] at a second descent (i.e. another time).
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ نَزۡلَةً أُخۡرَىٰ

data.price: 14. Near Sidrat-ul-Muntaha (a lote-tree of the utmost boundary over the seventh heaven beyond which none can pass).
data.arabic: عِندَ سِدۡرَةِ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ

data.price: 15. Near it is the Paradise of Abode.
data.arabic: عِندَهَا جَنَّةُ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰٓ

data.price: 16. When that covered the lote-tree which did cover it![2]
data.arabic: إِذۡ يَغۡشَى ٱلسِّدۡرَةَ مَا يَغۡشَىٰ
data.footnotes: (V.53:16) It is said that the Lot-Tree was covered with the light of Allah along with the angels and also with different kinds of colours. (Please see T. Ibn Kathîr).

data.price: 17. The sight (of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) turned not aside (right or left), nor it transgressed beyond the limit (ordained for it).
data.arabic: مَا زَاغَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ

data.price: 18. Indeed he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) did see of the Greatest Signs, of his Lord (Allâh).
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ رَأَىٰ مِنۡ ءَايَٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰٓ

data.price: 19. Have you then considered Al-Lât, and Al-‘Uzzâ (two idols of the pagan Arabs)[3]
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱللَّٰتَ وَٱلۡعُزَّىٰ
data.footnotes: (V.53:19) See the footnote (A) of (V.2: 219).

data.price: 20. And Manât (another idol of the pagan Arabs), the other third?
data.arabic: وَمَنَوٰةَ ٱلثَّالِثَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰٓ

data.price: 21. Is it for you the males and for Him the females?
data.arabic: أَلَكُمُ ٱلذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ

data.price: 22. That indeed is a division most unfair!
data.arabic: تِلۡكَ إِذٗا قِسۡمَةٞ ضِيزَىٰٓ

data.price: 23. They are but names which you have named - you and your fathers - for which Allâh has sent down no authority. They follow but a guess and that which they themselves desire, whereas there has surely come to them the Guidance from their Lord!
data.arabic: إِنۡ هِيَ إِلَّآ أَسۡمَآءٞ سَمَّيۡتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمۡ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلۡطَٰنٍۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهۡوَى ٱلۡأَنفُسُۖ وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ

data.price: 24. Or shall man have what he wishes?
data.arabic: أَمۡ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ

data.price: 25. But to Allâh belongs the last (Hereafter) and the first (the world).
data.arabic: فَلِلَّهِ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: 26. And there are many angels in the heavens, whose intercession will avail nothing except after Allâh has given leave for whom He wills and is pleased with.
data.arabic: ۞ وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٖ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغۡنِي شَفَٰعَتُهُمۡ شَيۡـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ أَن يَأۡذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرۡضَىٰٓ

data.price: 27. Verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, name the angels with female names.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ تَسۡمِيَةَ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ

data.price: 28. But they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and verily, guess is no substitute for the truth.
data.arabic: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنۡ عِلۡمٍۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ شَيۡـٔٗا

data.price: 29. Therefore withdraw (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) from him who turns away from Our Reminder (this Qur’ân) and desires nothing but the life of this world.
data.arabic: فَأَعۡرِضۡ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكۡرِنَا وَلَمۡ يُرِدۡ إِلَّا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا

data.price: 30. That is what they could reach of knowledge. Verily, your Lord it is He Who knows best him who goes astray from His Path, and He knows best him who receives guidance.
data.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مَبۡلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهۡتَدَىٰ

data.price: 31. And to Allâh belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, that He may requite those who do evil with that which they have done (i.e. punish them in Hell), and reward those who do good, with what is best (i.e. Paradise).
data.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ لِيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَٰٓـُٔواْ بِمَا عَمِلُواْ وَيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحۡسَنُواْ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَى

data.price: 32. Those who avoid great sins (See the Qur’ân, Verses: 6:152,153) and Al-Fawâhish (illegal sexual intercourse) except the small faults, - verily, your Lord is of Vast Forgiveness. He knows you well when He created you from the earth (Adam), and when you were fetuses in your mothers’ wombs. So ascribe not purity to yourselves. He knows best him who fears Allâh and keeps his duty to Him [i.e. those who are Al-Muttaqûn (the pious. See V.2:2)].
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجۡتَنِبُونَ كَبَٰٓئِرَ ٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِۚ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِكُمۡ إِذۡ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِذۡ أَنتُمۡ أَجِنَّةٞ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَٰتِكُمۡۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓاْ أَنفُسَكُمۡۖ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ

data.price: 33. Did you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) observe him who turned away (from Islâm).
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: 34. And gave a little, then stopped (giving)?
data.arabic: وَأَعۡطَىٰ قَلِيلٗا وَأَكۡدَىٰٓ

data.price: 35. Is with him the knowledge of the Unseen so that he sees?
data.arabic: أَعِندَهُۥ عِلۡمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰٓ

data.price: 36. Or is he not informed with what is in the Pages (Scripture) of Mûsâ (Moses),
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَمۡ يُنَبَّأۡ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ

data.price: 37. And of Ibrâhîm (Abraham) who fulfilled (or conveyed) all that (Allâh ordered him to do or convey):
data.arabic: وَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلَّذِي وَفَّىٰٓ

data.price: 38. That no burdened person (with sins) shall bear the burden (sins) of another.
data.arabic: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٞ وِزۡرَ أُخۡرَىٰ

data.price: 39. And that man can have nothing but what he does (good or bad).[1]
data.arabic: وَأَن لَّيۡسَ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
data.footnotes:
(V.53:39) Narrated Abû Hurairah رضي الله عنه Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "When a person is dead, his deeds cease (are stopped) except from three:
a) Deeds of continuous Sadaqah (act of charity): e.g. an orphan home (orphanage) or a well for giving water to drink, etc.
b) (Written) knowledge with which mankind gets benefit.
c) A righteous, pious son (or daughter) who begs Allâh to forgive his (or her) parents."
(Sahih Muslim. The Book of Wasâyâ (Wills and Testaments).

data.price: 40. And that his deeds will be seen.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ سَعۡيَهُۥ سَوۡفَ يُرَىٰ

data.price: 41. Then he will be recompensed with a full and the best recompense.[2]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يُجۡزَىٰهُ ٱلۡجَزَآءَ ٱلۡأَوۡفَىٰ
data.footnotes: (V.53:41) See the footnote (A) of (V.6:61).

data.price: 42. And that to your Lord (Allâh) is the End (Return of everything).
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ

data.price: 43. And that it is He (Allâh) Who makes (whom He wills) laugh, and makes (whom He wills) weep.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَضۡحَكَ وَأَبۡكَىٰ

data.price: 44. And that it is He (Allâh) Who causes death and gives life.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحۡيَا

data.price: 45. And that He (Allâh) creates the pairs, male and female,
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ خَلَقَ ٱلزَّوۡجَيۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰ

data.price: 46. From Nutfah (drops of semen - male and female discharges) when it is emitted.
data.arabic: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ إِذَا تُمۡنَىٰ

data.price: 47. And that upon Him (Allâh) is another bringing forth (Resurrection).
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰ

data.price: 48. And that it is He (Allâh) Who gives much or a little (of wealth and contentment)
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَغۡنَىٰ وَأَقۡنَىٰ

data.price: 49. And that He (Allâh) is the Lord of Sirius (the star which the pagan Arabs used to worship).
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلشِّعۡرَىٰ

data.price: 50. And that it is He (Allâh) Who destroyed the former ‘Âd (people),
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥٓ أَهۡلَكَ عَادًا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: 51. And Thamûd (people): He spared none of them.
data.arabic: وَثَمُودَاْ فَمَآ أَبۡقَىٰ

data.price: 52. And the people of Nûh (Noah) aforetime. Verily, they were more unjust and more rebellious and transgressing [in disobeying Allâh and His Messenger Nûh (Noah) عليه السلام].
data.arabic: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ هُمۡ أَظۡلَمَ وَأَطۡغَىٰ

data.price: 53. And He destroyed the overthrown cities [of Sodom to which Prophet Lût (Lot) was sent].
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَةَ أَهۡوَىٰ

data.price: 54. So there covered them that which did cover (i.e. torment with stones).
data.arabic: فَغَشَّىٰهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ

data.price: 55. Then which of the Graces of your Lord (O man!) will you doubt?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ

data.price: 56. This (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is a warner (Messenger) of the (series of) warners (Messengers) of old.[1]
data.arabic: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٞ مِّنَ ٱلنُّذُرِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: (V.53:56) See the footnote of (V.2: 252).

data.price: 57. The Day of Resurrection draws near.
data.arabic: أَزِفَتِ ٱلۡأٓزِفَةُ

data.price: 58. None besides Allâh can avert it (or advance it or delay it).
data.arabic: لَيۡسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ

data.price: 59. Do you then wonder at this recitation (the Qur’ân)?
data.arabic: أَفَمِنۡ هَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِ تَعۡجَبُونَ

data.price: 60. And you laugh at it and weep not,
data.arabic: وَتَضۡحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبۡكُونَ

data.price: 61. Wasting your (precious) lifetime in pastime and amusements (singing, etc.).
data.arabic: وَأَنتُمۡ سَٰمِدُونَ

data.price: 62. So fall you down in prostration to Allâh and worship Him (Alone).
data.arabic: فَٱسۡجُدُواْۤ لِلَّهِۤ وَٱعۡبُدُواْ۩

data.price: 1. The Hour has drawn near, and the moon has been cleft asunder (the people of Makkah requested Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم to show them a miracle, so he showed them the splitting of the moon).[2]
data.arabic: ٱقۡتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلۡقَمَرُ
data.footnotes: (V.54:1) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه: The people of Makkah asked the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم to show them a sign (miracle). So he showed them (the miracle) of the cleaving of the moon. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadîth No.390).

data.price: 2. And if they see a sign, they turn away, and say: "This is continuous magic."
data.arabic: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ ءَايَةٗ يُعۡرِضُواْ وَيَقُولُواْ سِحۡرٞ مُّسۡتَمِرّٞ

data.price: 3. They belied (the Verses of Allâh - this Qur’ân), and followed their own lusts. And every matter will be settled (according to the kind of deeds: good deeds will take their doers to Paradise, and similarly evil deeds will take their doers to Hell).
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبُواْ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓاْ أَهۡوَآءَهُمۡۚ وَكُلُّ أَمۡرٖ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ

data.price: 4. And indeed there has come to them news (in this Qur’ân) wherein there is (enough warning) to check (them from evil),
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزۡدَجَرٌ

data.price: 5. Perfect wisdom (this Qur’ân), but (the preaching of) warners benefit them not.
data.arabic: حِكۡمَةُۢ بَٰلِغَةٞۖ فَمَا تُغۡنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ

data.price: 6. So (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) withdraw from them. The Day that the caller will call (them) to a terrible thing.
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡۘ يَوۡمَ يَدۡعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ نُّكُرٍ

data.price: 7. They will come forth, with humbled eyes from (their) graves as if they were locusts spread abroad,
data.arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمۡ جَرَادٞ مُّنتَشِرٞ

data.price: 8. Hastening towards the caller. The disbelievers will say: "This is a hard Day."
data.arabic: مُّهۡطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِۖ يَقُولُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوۡمٌ عَسِرٞ

data.price: 9. The people of Nûh (Noah) denied (their Messenger) before them. They rejected Our slave, and said: "A madman!" and he was insolently rebuked and threatened.
data.arabic: ۞ كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ فَكَذَّبُواْ عَبۡدَنَا وَقَالُواْ مَجۡنُونٞ وَٱزۡدُجِرَ

data.price: 10. Then he invoked his Lord (saying): "I have been overcome, so help (me)!"
data.arabic: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَغۡلُوبٞ فَٱنتَصِرۡ

data.price: 11. So We opened the gates of the heaven with water pouring forth.
data.arabic: فَفَتَحۡنَآ أَبۡوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٖ مُّنۡهَمِرٖ

data.price: 12. And We caused springs to gush forth from the earth. So the waters (of the heaven and the earth) met for a matter predestined.
data.arabic: وَفَجَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ عُيُونٗا فَٱلۡتَقَى ٱلۡمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمۡرٖ قَدۡ قُدِرَ

data.price: 13. And We carried him on a (ship) made of planks and nails,
data.arabic: وَحَمَلۡنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلۡوَٰحٖ وَدُسُرٖ

data.price: 14. Floating under Our Eyes: a reward for him who had been rejected!
data.arabic: تَجۡرِي بِأَعۡيُنِنَا جَزَآءٗ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ

data.price: 15. And indeed, We have left this as a sign. Then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
data.arabic: وَلَقَد تَّرَكۡنَٰهَآ ءَايَةٗ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: 16. Then how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: 17. And We have indeed made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any one who will remember (or receive admonition)?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: 18. ‘Âd (people) belied (their Prophet, Hûd); then how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ عَادٞ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: 19. Verily, We sent against them a furious wind of harsh voice on a day of evil omen and continuous calamity.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ رِيحٗا صَرۡصَرٗا فِي يَوۡمِ نَحۡسٖ مُّسۡتَمِرّٖ

data.price: 20. Plucking out men as if they were uprooted stems of date-palms.
data.arabic: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٖ مُّنقَعِرٖ

data.price: 21. Then, how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: 22. And We have indeed made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: 23. Thamûd (people also) belied the warnings.
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: 24. And they said: "A man, alone among us - shall we follow him? Truly then we should be in error and distress (or madness)!"
data.arabic: فَقَالُوٓاْ أَبَشَرٗا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدٗا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذٗا لَّفِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٍ

data.price: 25. "Is it that the Reminder is sent to him [Prophet Sâlih عليه السلام] alone from among us? Nay, he is an insolent liar!"
data.arabic: أَءُلۡقِيَ ٱلذِّكۡرُ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَا بَلۡ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٞ

data.price: 26. Tomorrow they will come to know who is the liar, the insolent one!
data.arabic: سَيَعۡلَمُونَ غَدٗا مَّنِ ٱلۡكَذَّابُ ٱلۡأَشِرُ

data.price: 27. Verily, We are sending the she-camel as a test for them. So watch them [O Sâlih عليه السلام], and be patient!
data.arabic: إِنَّا مُرۡسِلُواْ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتۡنَةٗ لَّهُمۡ فَٱرۡتَقِبۡهُمۡ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ

data.price: 28. And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them, each one’s right to drink being established (by turns).
data.arabic: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ أَنَّ ٱلۡمَآءَ قِسۡمَةُۢ بَيۡنَهُمۡۖ كُلُّ شِرۡبٖ مُّحۡتَضَرٞ

data.price: 29. But they called their comrade and he took (a sword) and killed (her).
data.arabic: فَنَادَوۡاْ صَاحِبَهُمۡ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ

data.price: 30. Then, how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: 31. Verily, We sent against them a single Saihah (torment - awful cry), and they became like the stubble of a fold-builder.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَكَانُواْ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلۡمُحۡتَظِرِ

data.price: 32. And indeed, We have made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: 33. The people of Lût (Lot) belied the warnings.
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ لُوطِۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: 34. Verily, We sent against them a violent storm of stones (which destroyed them all), except the family of Lût (Lot), them We saved in the last hour of the night,
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٖۖ نَّجَّيۡنَٰهُم بِسَحَرٖ

data.price: 35. As a Favour from Us. Thus do We reward him who gives thanks (by obeying Us).
data.arabic: نِّعۡمَةٗ مِّنۡ عِندِنَاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي مَن شَكَرَ

data.price: 36. And he [Lût (Lot)] indeed had warned them of Our Seizure (punishment), but they did doubt the warnings!
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَنذَرَهُم بَطۡشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوۡاْ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: 37. And they indeed sought to shame his guest (by asking to commit sodomy with them). So We blinded their eyes, (saying) "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيۡفِهِۦ فَطَمَسۡنَآ أَعۡيُنَهُمۡ فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: 38. And verily, an abiding torment seized them early in the morning.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ صَبَّحَهُم بُكۡرَةً عَذَابٞ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ

data.price: 39. "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."
data.arabic: فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: 40. And indeed, We have made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: 41. And indeed, warnings came to the people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) [through Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron)].
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ

data.price: 42. (They) belied all Our Signs, so We seized them with a Seizure of the All-Mighty, All-Capable (Omnipotent).
data.arabic: كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُمۡ أَخۡذَ عَزِيزٖ مُّقۡتَدِرٍ

data.price: 43. Are your disbelievers (O Quraish!) better than these [nations of Nûh (Noah), Lût (Lot), Sâlih, and the people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) who were destroyed)? Or have you an immunity (against Our Torment) in the Divine Scriptures?
data.arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمۡ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أُوْلَٰٓئِكُمۡ أَمۡ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٞ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ

data.price: 44. Or say they: "We are a great multitude, victorious?"
data.arabic: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ نَحۡنُ جَمِيعٞ مُّنتَصِرٞ

data.price: 45. Their multitude will be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
data.arabic: سَيُهۡزَمُ ٱلۡجَمۡعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ

data.price: 46. Nay, but the Hour is their appointed time (for their full recompense), and the Hour will be more grievous and more bitter.
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوۡعِدُهُمۡ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدۡهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ

data.price: 47. Verily the Mujrimûn (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals) are in error (in this world) and will burn (in the Hell-fire in the Hereafter).
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٖ

data.price: 48. The Day they will be dragged on their faces into the Fire (it will be said to them): "Taste you the touch of Hell!"[1]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُسۡحَبُونَ فِي ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ ذُوقُواْ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
data.footnotes: (V.54:48) See (V.25:34) and the footnote of (V.17:97).

data.price: 49. Verily, We have created all things with Qadar (Divine Preordainments of all things before their creation as written in the Book of Decrees Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz).
data.arabic: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَٰهُ بِقَدَرٖ

data.price: 50. And Our Commandment is but one as the twinkling of an eye.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَمۡرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٞ كَلَمۡحِۭ بِٱلۡبَصَرِ

data.price: 51. And indeed, We have destroyed your likes; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَآ أَشۡيَاعَكُمۡ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: 52. And everything they have done is noted in (their) Records (of deeds).
data.arabic: وَكُلُّ شَيۡءٖ فَعَلُوهُ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ

data.price: 53. And everything, small and big, is written down (in Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz already beforehand i.e. before it befalls, or is done by its doer: الإيمان بالقدر) (See the Qur’ân V.57:22 and its footnote).
data.arabic: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٖ وَكَبِيرٖ مُّسۡتَطَرٌ

data.price: 54. Verily, The Muttaqûn (the pious - see V.2:2), will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers (Paradise).
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَهَرٖ

data.price: 55. In a seat of truth (i.e. Paradise), near the Omnipotent King (Allâh, the One, the All-Blessed, the Most High, the Owner of Majesty and Honour).
data.arabic: فِي مَقۡعَدِ صِدۡقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٖ مُّقۡتَدِرِۭ

data.price: 1. The Most Gracious (Allâh)!
data.arabic: ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ

data.price: 2. He has taught (you mankind) the Qur’ân (by His Mercy).
data.arabic: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ

data.price: 3. He created man.
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ

data.price: 4. He taught him eloquent speech.
data.arabic: عَلَّمَهُ ٱلۡبَيَانَ

data.price: 5. The sun and the moon run on their fixed courses (exactly) calculated with measured out stages for each (for reckoning).
data.arabic: ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ بِحُسۡبَانٖ

data.price: 6. And the herbs (or stars) and the trees both prostrate themselves (to Allah - See V.22:18) (Tafsir Ibn Kathir)
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّجۡمُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ يَسۡجُدَانِ

data.price: 7. And the heaven: He has raised it high, and He has set up the Balance.
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ

data.price: 8. In order that you may not transgress (due) balance.
data.arabic: أَلَّا تَطۡغَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡمِيزَانِ

data.price: 9. And observe the weight with equity and do not make the balance deficient.
data.arabic: وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلۡوَزۡنَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ وَلَا تُخۡسِرُواْ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ

data.price: 10. And the earth: He has put down (laid) for the creatures.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلۡأَنَامِ

data.price: 11. Therein are fruits and date-palms producing sheathed fruit-stalks (enclosing dates).
data.arabic: فِيهَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَٱلنَّخۡلُ ذَاتُ ٱلۡأَكۡمَامِ

data.price: 12. And also corn, with (its) leaves and stalk for fodder, and sweet-scented plants.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡحَبُّ ذُو ٱلۡعَصۡفِ وَٱلرَّيۡحَانُ

data.price: 13. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 14. He created man (Adam) from sounding clay like the clay of pottery.
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ كَٱلۡفَخَّارِ

data.price: 15. And the jinn: He created from a smokeless flame of fire.
data.arabic: وَخَلَقَ ٱلۡجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٖ مِّن نَّارٖ

data.price: 16. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 17. (He is) the Lord of the two easts (places of sunrise during early summer and early winter) and the Lord of the two wests (places of sunset during early summer and early winter).
data.arabic: رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقَيۡنِ وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَغۡرِبَيۡنِ

data.price: 18. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 19. He has let loose the two seas (the salt and fresh water) meeting together.
data.arabic: مَرَجَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَيۡنِ يَلۡتَقِيَانِ

data.price: 20. Between them is a barrier which none of them can transgress.
data.arabic: بَيۡنَهُمَا بَرۡزَخٞ لَّا يَبۡغِيَانِ

data.price: 21. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 22. Out of them both come out pearl and coral.
data.arabic: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهُمَا ٱللُّؤۡلُؤُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ

data.price: 23. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 24. And His are the ships going and coming in the seas, like mountains.
data.arabic: وَلَهُ ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِي ٱلۡبَحۡرِ كَٱلۡأَعۡلَٰمِ

data.price: 25. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 26. Whatsoever is on it (the earth) will perish.
data.arabic: كُلُّ مَنۡ عَلَيۡهَا فَانٖ

data.price: 27. And the Face of your Lord full of Majesty and Honour will remain forever.
data.arabic: وَيَبۡقَىٰ وَجۡهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ

data.price: 28. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 29. Whosoever is in the heavens and on earth begs of Him (its needs from Him). Every day He is (engaged) in some affair (such as giving honour or disgrace to some, life or death to some, etc.)!
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ كُلَّ يَوۡمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأۡنٖ

data.price: 30. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 31. We shall attend to you, O you two classes (jinn and men)!
data.arabic: سَنَفۡرُغُ لَكُمۡ أَيُّهَ ٱلثَّقَلَانِ

data.price: 32. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 33. O assembly of jinn and men! If you have power to pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth, then pass beyond (them)! But you will never be able to pass them, except with authority (from Allâh)!
data.arabic: يَٰمَعۡشَرَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ أَن تَنفُذُواْ مِنۡ أَقۡطَارِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱنفُذُواْۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ

data.price: 34. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 35. There will be sent against you both, smokeless flames of fire and (molten) brass, and you will not be able to defend yourselves.
data.arabic: يُرۡسَلُ عَلَيۡكُمَا شُوَاظٞ مِّن نَّارٖ وَنُحَاسٞ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ

data.price: 36. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 37. Then when the heaven is rent asunder, and it becomes rosy or red like red-oil, or red hide - [See V.70:8]
data.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ وَرۡدَةٗ كَٱلدِّهَانِ

data.price: 38. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 39. So on that Day no question will be asked of man or jinns as to his sin, [because they have already been known from their faces either white (dwellers of Paradise - true believers of Islamic Monotheism) or black (dwellers of Hell - polytheists; disbelievers, criminals)].
data.arabic: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُسۡـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٞ وَلَا جَآنّٞ

data.price: 40. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 41. The Mujrimûn (polytheists, criminals, sinners) will be known by their marks (black faces), and they will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
data.arabic: يُعۡرَفُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ بِسِيمَٰهُمۡ فَيُؤۡخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِي وَٱلۡأَقۡدَامِ

data.price: 42. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 43. This is the Hell which the Mujrimûn (polytheists, criminals, sinners) denied.
data.arabic: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ

data.price: 44. They will go between it (Hell) and the fierce boiling water!
data.arabic: يَطُوفُونَ بَيۡنَهَا وَبَيۡنَ حَمِيمٍ ءَانٖ

data.price: 45. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 46. But for him who[1] fears the standing before his Lord, there will be two Gardens (i.e. in Paradise).[2]
data.arabic: وَلِمَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ جَنَّتَانِ
data.footnotes:
[1] (V.55:46) : The true believer of Islâmic Monotheism who performs all the duties ordained by Allâh and His Messenger Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم, and abstain from all kinds of sin and evil deeds prohibited in Islâm.
[2] (V.55:46) See the footnote of (V.23:60).

data.price: 47. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 48. With spreading branches.
data.arabic: ذَوَاتَآ أَفۡنَانٖ

data.price: 49. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 50. In them (both) will be two springs flowing (free).
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيۡنَانِ تَجۡرِيَانِ

data.price: 51. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 52. In them (both) will be every kind of fruit in pairs.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَٰكِهَةٖ زَوۡجَانِ

data.price: 53. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 54. Reclining upon the couches lined with silk brocade, and the fruits of the two Gardens will be near at hand.
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشِۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنۡ إِسۡتَبۡرَقٖۚ وَجَنَى ٱلۡجَنَّتَيۡنِ دَانٖ

data.price: 55. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 56. Wherein both will be Qâsirât-ut-Tarf [chaste females (wives) restraining their glances, desiring none except their husbands], with whom no man or jinni has had tamth[3] before them.
data.arabic: فِيهِنَّ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
data.footnotes: (V.55:56): Tamth means: Opening their hymens with sexual intercourse.

data.price: 57. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 58. (In beauty) they are like rubies and coral.
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ ٱلۡيَاقُوتُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ

data.price: 59. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 60. Is there any reward for good other than good?
data.arabic: هَلۡ جَزَآءُ ٱلۡإِحۡسَٰنِ إِلَّا ٱلۡإِحۡسَٰنُ

data.price: 61. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 62. And besides these two, there are two other Gardens (i.e. in Paradise).
data.arabic: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ

data.price: 63. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 64. Dark green (in colour).
data.arabic: مُدۡهَآمَّتَانِ

data.price: 65. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 66. In them (both) will be two springs gushing forth.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيۡنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ

data.price: 67. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 68. In them (both) will be fruits, and date-palms and pomegranates.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَنَخۡلٞ وَرُمَّانٞ

data.price: 69. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 70. Therein (Gardens) will be Khairâtun-Hisân [fair (wives) good and beautiful];
data.arabic: فِيهِنَّ خَيۡرَٰتٌ حِسَانٞ

data.price: 71. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 72. Hûr[1] (beautiful, fair females) guarded in pavilions;
data.arabic: حُورٞ مَّقۡصُورَٰتٞ فِي ٱلۡخِيَامِ
data.footnotes: (V.55:72) See footnote of (V.52:20).

data.price: 73. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 74. With whom no man or jinni has had tamth[2] before them.
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
data.footnotes: (V.55:74) Tamth means: Opening their hymens with sexual intercourse.

data.price: 75. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 76. Reclining on green cushions and rich beautiful mattresses.
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفۡرَفٍ خُضۡرٖ وَعَبۡقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٖ

data.price: 77. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinn and men) deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: 78. Blessed be the Name of your Lord (Allâh), the Owner of Majesty and Honour.
data.arabic: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱسۡمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ

data.price: 1. When the Event (i.e. the Day of Resurrection) befalls.
data.arabic: إِذَا وَقَعَتِ ٱلۡوَاقِعَةُ

data.price: 2. And there can be no denial of its befalling.
data.arabic: لَيۡسَ لِوَقۡعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ

data.price: 3. Bringing low (some - those who will enter Hell) Exalting (others - those who will enter Paradise). [Tafsir Ibn Kathir]
data.arabic: خَافِضَةٞ رَّافِعَةٌ

data.price: 4. When the earth will be shaken with a terrible shake.
data.arabic: إِذَا رُجَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ رَجّٗا

data.price: 5. And the mountains will be powdered to dust,
data.arabic: وَبُسَّتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ بَسّٗا

data.price: 6. So that they will become floating dust particles.
data.arabic: فَكَانَتۡ هَبَآءٗ مُّنۢبَثّٗا

data.price: 7. And you (all) will be in three groups.
data.arabic: وَكُنتُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا ثَلَٰثَةٗ

data.price: 8. So those on the Right Hand (i.e. those who will be given their Records in their right hands) - how (fortunate) will be those on the Right Hand! (As a respect for them, because they will enter Paradise).
data.arabic: فَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ

data.price: 9. And those on the Left Hand (i.e. those who will be given their Record in their left hands) - how (unfortunate) will be those on the Left Hand! (As a disgrace for them, because they will enter Hell).
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ

data.price: 10. And those foremost [(in Islâmic Faith of Monotheism and in performing righteous deeds) in the life of this world on the very first call for to embrace Islâm] will be foremost (in Paradise).
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ ٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ

data.price: 11. These will be the nearest (to Allâh).
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: 12. In the Gardens of Delight (Paradise).
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: 13. A multitude of those (foremost) will be from the first generations (who embraced Islâm).
data.arabic: ثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: 14. And a few of those (foremost) will be from the later generations.
data.arabic: وَقَلِيلٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: 15. (They will be) on thrones woven with gold and precious stones.
data.arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّوۡضُونَةٖ

data.price: 16. Reclining thereon, face to face.
data.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَيۡهَا مُتَقَٰبِلِينَ

data.price: 17. Immortal boys will go around them (serving),
data.arabic: يَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ

data.price: 18. With cups, and jugs, and a glass of flowing wine,
data.arabic: بِأَكۡوَابٖ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأۡسٖ مِّن مَّعِينٖ

data.price: 19. Wherefrom they will get neither any aching of the head, nor any intoxication.
data.arabic: لَّا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنۡهَا وَلَا يُنزِفُونَ

data.price: 20. And with fruit that they may choose.
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٖ مِّمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ

data.price: 21. And with the flesh of fowls that they desire.
data.arabic: وَلَحۡمِ طَيۡرٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ

data.price: 22. And (there will be) Hûr (fair females) with wide, lovely eyes (as wives for "Al-Muttaqûn" - the pious - See V. 2:2),
data.arabic: وَحُورٌ عِينٞ

data.price: 23. Like unto preserved pearls.
data.arabic: كَأَمۡثَٰلِ ٱللُّؤۡلُوِٕ ٱلۡمَكۡنُونِ

data.price: 24. A reward for what they used to do.
data.arabic: جَزَآءَۢ بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: 25. No Laghw (dirty, false, evil vain talk) will they hear therein, nor any sinful speech (like backbiting).
data.arabic: لَا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمًا

data.price: 26. But only the saying of: Salâm! Salâm! (greetings with peace)![1]
data.arabic: إِلَّا قِيلٗا سَلَٰمٗا سَلَٰمٗا
data.footnotes: (V.56:26) See the footnote (A) of (V.29:64).

data.price: 27. And those on the Right Hand - how (fortunate) will be those on the Right Hand?
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡيَمِينِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: 28. (They will be) among thornless lote-trees,
data.arabic: فِي سِدۡرٖ مَّخۡضُودٖ

data.price: 29. And among Talh (banana-trees) with fruits piled one above another,
data.arabic: وَطَلۡحٖ مَّنضُودٖ

data.price: 30. And in shade long-extended,
data.arabic: وَظِلّٖ مَّمۡدُودٖ

data.price: 31. And by water flowing constantly,
data.arabic: وَمَآءٖ مَّسۡكُوبٖ

data.price: 32. And fruit in plenty,
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٖ كَثِيرَةٖ

data.price: 33. Whose supply is not cut off (by change of season), nor are they out of reach,
data.arabic: لَّا مَقۡطُوعَةٖ وَلَا مَمۡنُوعَةٖ

data.price: 34. And on couches or thrones, raised high.
data.arabic: وَفُرُشٖ مَّرۡفُوعَةٍ

data.price: 35. Verily, We have created them (maidens) of special creation.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنشَأۡنَٰهُنَّ إِنشَآءٗ

data.price: 36. And made them virgins.
data.arabic: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُنَّ أَبۡكَارًا

data.price: 37. Loving (their husbands only), (and) of equal age.
data.arabic: عُرُبًا أَتۡرَابٗا

data.price: 38. For those on the Right Hand.
data.arabic: لِّأَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: 39. A multitude of those (on the Right Hand) will be from the first generation (who embraced Islâm).
data.arabic: ثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: 40. And a multitude of those (on the Right Hand) will be from the later generations.
data.arabic: وَثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: 41. And those on the Left Hand - how (unfortunate) will be those on the Left Hand?
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ

data.price: 42. In fierce hot wind and boiling water,
data.arabic: فِي سَمُومٖ وَحَمِيمٖ

data.price: 43. And shadow of black smoke,
data.arabic: وَظِلّٖ مِّن يَحۡمُومٖ

data.price: 44. (That shadow) neither cool, nor (even) pleasant,
data.arabic: لَّا بَارِدٖ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ

data.price: 45. Verily, before that, they indulged in luxury,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتۡرَفِينَ

data.price: 46. And were persisting in great sin (joining partners in worship along with Allâh, committing murder and other crimes)[2]
data.arabic: وَكَانُواْ يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى ٱلۡحِنثِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
data.footnotes: (V.56:46) See the footnote (B) of (V.3:130).

data.price: 47. And they used to say: "When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be resurrected?
data.arabic: وَكَانُواْ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ

data.price: 48. "And also our forefathers?"
data.arabic: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ

data.price: 49. Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "(Yes) verily, those of old, and those of later times.
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ وَٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: 50. "All will surely be gathered together for appointed Meeting of a known Day.
data.arabic: لَمَجۡمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَٰتِ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ

data.price: 51. "Then moreover, verily you the erring-ones, the deniers (of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: 52. "You verily will eat of the trees of Zaqqûm.
data.arabic: لَأٓكِلُونَ مِن شَجَرٖ مِّن زَقُّومٖ

data.price: 53. "Then you will fill your bellies therewith,
data.arabic: فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ

data.price: 54. "And drink boiling water on top of it.
data.arabic: فَشَٰرِبُونَ عَلَيۡهِ مِنَ ٱلۡحَمِيمِ

data.price: 55. "And you will drink (that) like thirsty camels!"
data.arabic: فَشَٰرِبُونَ شُرۡبَ ٱلۡهِيمِ

data.price: 56. That will be their entertainment on the Day of Recompense!
data.arabic: هَٰذَا نُزُلُهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 57. We created you: then why do you believe not?
data.arabic: نَحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ فَلَوۡلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ

data.price: 58. Then tell Me (about) the (human) semen that you emit.
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُم مَّا تُمۡنُونَ

data.price: 59. Is it you who create it (i.e. make this semen into a perfect human being), or are We the Creator?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَخۡلُقُونَهُۥٓ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ

data.price: 60. We have decreed death to you all, and We are not outstripped,
data.arabic: نَحۡنُ قَدَّرۡنَا بَيۡنَكُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ

data.price: 61. To transfigure you and create you in (forms) that you know not.
