data.arabic: فَقُتِلَ كَيۡفَ قَدَّرَ

data.price: 20. And once more let him be cursed: how he plotted!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيۡفَ قَدَّرَ

data.price: 21. Then he thought.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ

data.price: 22. Then he frowned and he looked in a bad tempered way;
data.arabic: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ

data.price: 23. Then he turned back, and was proud.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرَ

data.price: 24. Then he said: "This is nothing but magic from that of old,
data.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ يُؤۡثَرُ

data.price: 25. "This is nothing but the word of a human being!"
data.arabic: إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا قَوۡلُ ٱلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: 26. I will cast him into Hell-fire.[1]
data.arabic: سَأُصۡلِيهِ سَقَرَ
data.footnotes: (V.74:26) See the footnote of (V.17:97).

data.price: 27. And what will make you know (exactly) what Hell-fire is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ

data.price: 28. It spares not (any sinner), nor does it leave (anything unburnt)!
data.arabic: لَا تُبۡقِي وَلَا تَذَرُ

data.price: 29. Burning and blackening the skins!
data.arabic: لَوَّاحَةٞ لِّلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: 30. Over it are nineteen (angels as guardians and keepers of Hell).
data.arabic: عَلَيۡهَا تِسۡعَةَ عَشَرَ

data.price: 31. And We have set none but angels as guardians of the Fire. And We have fixed their number (19) only as a trial for the disbelievers, in order that the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) may arrive at a certainty [that this Qur’ân is the truth as it agrees with their Books regarding the number (19) which is written in the Taurât (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] and that the believers may increase in Faith (as this Qur’ân is the truth), and that no doubt may be left for the people of the Scripture and the believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease (of hypocrisy) and the disbelievers may say: "What Allâh intends by this (curious) example ?" Thus Allâh leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none can know the hosts of your Lord but He. And this (Hell) is nothing else than a (warning) reminder to mankind.
data.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةٗۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِيَسۡتَيۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَيَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِيمَٰنٗا وَلَا يَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٞ وَٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلٗاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَا يَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: 32. Nay! And by the moon
data.arabic: كَلَّا وَٱلۡقَمَرِ

data.price: 33. And by the night when it withdraws.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذۡ أَدۡبَرَ

data.price: 34. And by the dawn when it brightens.
data.arabic: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَآ أَسۡفَرَ

data.price: 35. Verily, it (Hell, or their denial of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم, or the Day of Resurrection) is but one of the greatest (signs).
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا لَإِحۡدَى ٱلۡكُبَرِ

data.price: 36. A warning to mankind -
data.arabic: نَذِيرٗا لِّلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: 37. To any of you that chooses to go forward (by working righteous deeds), or to remain behind (by committing sins).
data.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ يَتَأَخَّرَ

data.price: 38. Every person is a pledge for what he has earned,
data.arabic: كُلُّ نَفۡسِۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتۡ رَهِينَةٌ

data.price: 39. Except those on the Right, (i.e. the pious true believers of Islâmic Monotheism).
data.arabic: إِلَّآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: 40. In Gardens (Paradise) they will ask one another,
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: 41. About Al-Mujrimûn (polytheists, criminals, disbelievers), (And they will say to them):
data.arabic: عَنِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: 42. "What has caused you to enter Hell?"
data.arabic: مَا سَلَكَكُمۡ فِي سَقَرَ

data.price: 43. They will say: "We were not of those who used to offer the Salât (prayers),[2]
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَمۡ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُصَلِّينَ
data.footnotes: (V.74:43) See the footnote of (V.8:39).

data.price: 44. "Nor we used to feed Al-Miskîn (the poor);
data.arabic: وَلَمۡ نَكُ نُطۡعِمُ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينَ

data.price: 45. "And we used to talk falsehood (all that which Allâh hated) with vain talkers.[3]
data.arabic: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلۡخَآئِضِينَ
data.footnotes: (V.74:45) See the footnote of (V.4:5).

data.price: 46. And we used to belie the Day of Recompense,[4]
data.arabic: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ
data.footnotes: (V.74:46) See the footnotes of (V.3:85).

data.price: 47. "Until there came to us (the death) that is certain."
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلۡيَقِينُ

data.price: 48. So no intercession of intercessors will be of any use to them.
data.arabic: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمۡ شَفَٰعَةُ ٱلشَّٰفِعِينَ

data.price: 49. Then what is wrong with them (i.e. the polytheists, the disbelievers) that they turn away from (receiving) admonition?
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُمۡ عَنِ ٱلتَّذۡكِرَةِ مُعۡرِضِينَ

data.price: 50. As if they were (frightened) wild donkeys.
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُمۡ حُمُرٞ مُّسۡتَنفِرَةٞ

data.price: 51. Fleeing from a hunter, or a lion, or a beast of prey.
data.arabic: فَرَّتۡ مِن قَسۡوَرَةِۭ

data.price: 52. Nay, everyone of them desires that he should be given pages spread out (coming from Allâh with a writing that Islâm is the right religion, and Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم has come with the truth from Allâh, the Lord of the heavens and earth).
data.arabic: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفٗا مُّنَشَّرَةٗ

data.price: 53. Nay! But they fear not the Hereafter (from Allâh’s punishment).
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ

data.price: 54. Nay, verily, this (Qur’an) is an admonition,
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ تَذۡكِرَةٞ

data.price: 55. So whosoever will (let him read it), and receive admonition (from it)!
data.arabic: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ

data.price: 56. And they will not receive admonition unless Allâh wills; He (Allâh) is the One, deserving that mankind should be afraid of, and should be dutiful to Him, and should not take any Ilâh (god) along with Him, and He is the One Who forgives (sins).
data.arabic: وَمَا يَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ

data.price: 1. I swear by the Day of Resurrection.
data.arabic: لَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ

data.price: 2. And I swear by the self-reproaching person (a believer).
data.arabic: وَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلنَّفۡسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ

data.price: 3. Does man (a disbeliever) think that We shall not assemble his bones?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجۡمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ

data.price: 4. Yes, We are Able to put together in perfect order the tips of his fingers.[1]
data.arabic: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُۥ
data.footnotes: (V.75:4) Each human being has his or her own special finger prints not resembling anyone else, indicating that our Lord (Allâh) is the Most Superior Creator of everything: Lâ ilâha illâ Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He).

data.price: 5. Nay! Man (denies Resurrection and Reckoning. So he) desires to continue committing sins.
data.arabic: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ لِيَفۡجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ

data.price: 6. He asks: "When will be this Day of Resurrection?"
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ

data.price: 7. So, when the sight shall be dazed.
data.arabic: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ

data.price: 8. And the moon will be eclipsed.
data.arabic: وَخَسَفَ ٱلۡقَمَرُ

data.price: 9. And the sun and moon will be joined together (by going one into the other or folded up or deprived of their light).[2]
data.arabic: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ
data.footnotes: (V.75:9) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The sun and the moon will be folded up (or joined together or deprived of their lights) on the Day of Resurrection." (See the Qur’ân 75:9) (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.4, Hadith No.422).

data.price: 10. On that Day man will say: "Where (is the refuge) to flee?"
data.arabic: يَقُولُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذٍ أَيۡنَ ٱلۡمَفَرُّ

data.price: 11. No! There is no refuge!
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ

data.price: 12. Unto your Lord (Alone) will be the place of rest that Day.
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقَرُّ

data.price: 13. On that Day man will be informed of what he sent forward (of his evil good deeds), and what he left behind (of his good or evil traditions).
data.arabic: يُنَبَّؤُاْ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ

data.price: 14. Nay! Man will be a witness against himself [as his body parts (skin, hands, legs, etc.) will speak about his deeds],
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفۡسِهِۦ بَصِيرَةٞ

data.price: 15. Though he may put forth his excuses (to cover his evil deeds).
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ أَلۡقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُۥ

data.price: 16. Move not your tongue concerning (the Qur’ân, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) to make haste therewith.
data.arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦٓ

data.price: 17. It is for Us to collect it and to give you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) the ability to recite it (the Qur’ân).
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا جَمۡعَهُۥ وَقُرۡءَانَهُۥ

data.price: 18. And when We have recited it to you [O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم through Jibrîl (Gabriel)], then follow its (the Qur’an’s) recital.
data.arabic: فَإِذَا قَرَأۡنَٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعۡ قُرۡءَانَهُۥ

data.price: 19. Then it is for Us (Allâh) to make it clear (to you).
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا بَيَانَهُۥ

data.price: 20. Not [as you think, that you (mankind) will not be resurrected and recompensed for your deeds], but you (men) love the present life of this world,
data.arabic: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ

data.price: 21. And neglect the Hereafter.
data.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ

data.price: 22. Some faces that Day shall be Nâdirah (shining and radiant).
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ نَّاضِرَةٌ

data.price: 23. Looking at their Lord (Allâh).
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٞ

data.price: 24. And some faces, that Day, will be Bâsirah (dark, gloomy, frowning, and sad),
data.arabic: وَوُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بَاسِرَةٞ

data.price: 25. Thinking that some calamity is about to fall on them.
data.arabic: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفۡعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٞ

data.price: 26. Nay, when (the soul) reaches to the collar bone (i.e. up to the throat in its exit),
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِيَ

data.price: 27. And it will be said: "Who can cure him (and save him from death)?"
data.arabic: وَقِيلَ مَنۡۜ رَاقٖ

data.price: 28. And he (the dying person) will conclude that it was (the time) of parting (death);
data.arabic: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلۡفِرَاقُ

data.price: 29. And one leg will be joined with another leg (shrouded).[1]
data.arabic: وَٱلۡتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ
data.footnotes: (V.75:29) Or it may mean: hardship and distress will be joined with another hardship and distress (i.e. distress of death, and of the thought as to what is going to happen to him in the Hereafter). (Tafsîr At-Tabarî ).

data.price: 30. The drive will be, on that Day, to your Lord (Allâh)!
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡمَسَاقُ

data.price: 31. So he (the disbeliever) neither believed (in this Qur’ân and in the Message of Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) nor prayed!
data.arabic: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ

data.price: 32. But on the contrary, he belied (this Qur’ân and the Message of Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) and turned away!
data.arabic: وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: 33. Then he walked in conceit (full pride) to his family admiring himself!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ يَتَمَطَّىٰٓ

data.price: 34. Woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you!
data.arabic: أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰ

data.price: 35. Again, woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰٓ

data.price: 36. Does man think that he will be left neglected (without being punished or rewarded for the obligatory duties enjoined by his Lord Allâh on him)?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَن يُتۡرَكَ سُدًى

data.price: 37. Was he not a Nutfah (mixed male and female sexual discharge) of semen emitted (poured forth)?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَكُ نُطۡفَةٗ مِّن مَّنِيّٖ يُمۡنَىٰ

data.price: 38. Then he became an ‘Alaqah (a clot); then (Allâh) shaped and fashioned (him) in due proportion.[2]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةٗ فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
data.footnotes: (V.75:38) See the footnote of (V.22:5).

data.price: 39. And made of him two sexes, male and female.
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَ مِنۡهُ ٱلزَّوۡجَيۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰٓ

data.price: 40. Is not He (Allâh Who does that) Able to give life to the dead? (Yes! He is Able to do all things).
data.arabic: أَلَيۡسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحۡـِۧيَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ

data.price: 1. Has there not been over man a period of time, when he was not a thing worth mentioning?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَٰنِ حِينٞ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ يَكُن شَيۡـٔٗا مَّذۡكُورًا

data.price: 2. Verily, We have created man from Nutfah (drops) of mixed semen (sexual discharge of man and woman), in order to try him: so We made him hearer and seer.
data.arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجٖ نَّبۡتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ سَمِيعَۢا بَصِيرًا

data.price: 3. Verily, We showed him the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.
data.arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

data.price: 4. Verily, We have prepared for the disbelievers iron chains, iron collars, and a blazing Fire.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَاْ وَأَغۡلَٰلٗا وَسَعِيرًا

data.price: 5. Verily,, the Abrâr (the pious believers of Islamic Monotheism), shall drink of a cup (of wine) mixed with (water from a spring in Paradise called) Kâfûr
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ يَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسٖ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا

data.price: 6. A spring wherefrom the slaves of Allâh will drink, causing it to gush forth abundantly.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِيرٗا

data.price: 7. They (are those who) fulfil (their) vows, and they fear a Day whose evil will be wide-spreading.
data.arabic: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوۡمٗا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِيرٗا

data.price: 8. And they give food, inspite of their love for it (or for the love of Him), to the Miskîn[1] (the poor), the orphan, and the captive
data.arabic: وَيُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِينٗا وَيَتِيمٗا وَأَسِيرًا
data.footnotes: (V.76:8) See the footnote of (V.2:83).

data.price: 9. (Saying): "We feed you seeking Allâh’s Countenance only. We wish for no reward, nor thanks from you.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَلَا شُكُورًا

data.price: 10. "Verily, We fear from our Lord a Day, hard and distressful, that will make the faces look horrible (from extreme dislike to it)."
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوۡمًا عَبُوسٗا قَمۡطَرِيرٗا

data.price: 11. So Allâh saved them from the evil of that Day, and gave them Nadrah (a light of beauty) and joy.
data.arabic: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةٗ وَسُرُورٗا

data.price: 12. And their recompense shall be Paradise, and silken garments, because they were patient.
data.arabic: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُواْ جَنَّةٗ وَحَرِيرٗا

data.price: 13. Reclining therein on raised thrones, they will see there neither the excessive heat of the sun, nor the excessive bitter cold, (as in Paradise there is no sun and no moon).
data.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوۡنَ فِيهَا شَمۡسٗا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِيرٗا

data.price: 14. And the shade thereof is close upon them, and the bunches of fruit thereof will hang low within their reach.
data.arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيۡهِمۡ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِيلٗا

data.price: 15. And amongst them will be passed round vessels of silver and cups of crystal -
data.arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٖ مِّن فِضَّةٖ وَأَكۡوَابٖ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِيرَا۠

data.price: 16. Crystal-clear, made of silver. They will determine the measure thereof (according to their wishes).
data.arabic: قَوَارِيرَاْ مِن فِضَّةٖ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقۡدِيرٗا

data.price: 17. And they will be given to drink there of a cup (of wine) mixed with Zanjabîl (ginger),
data.arabic: وَيُسۡقَوۡنَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا

data.price: 18. A spring there, called Salsabîl.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلۡسَبِيلٗا

data.price: 19. And round about them will (serve) boys of everlasting youth. If you see them, you would think them scattered pearls.
data.arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٗا مَّنثُورٗا

data.price: 20. And when you look there (in Paradise), you will see a delight (that cannot be imagined), and a great dominion.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيۡتَ نَعِيمٗا وَمُلۡكٗا كَبِيرًا

data.price: 21. Their garments will be of fine green silk, and gold embroidery. They will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure drink.
data.arabic: عَٰلِيَهُمۡ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرٞ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٞۖ وَحُلُّوٓاْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٖ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابٗا طَهُورًا

data.price: 22. (And it will be said to them): "Verily, this is a reward for you, and your endeavour has been accepted."
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَكَانَ سَعۡيُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا

data.price: 23. Verily, it is We Who have sent down the Qur’ân to you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) by stages.
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِيلٗا

data.price: 24. Therefore be patient (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) with constancy to the Command of your Lord (Allâh, by doing your duty to Him and by conveying His Message to mankind), and obey neither a sinner nor a disbeliever among them.
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورٗا

data.price: 25. And remember the Name of your Lord every morning and afternoon [i.e. offering of the Morning (Fajr), Zuhr, and ‘Asr prayers].
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ بُكۡرَةٗ وَأَصِيلٗا

data.price: 26. And during night, prostrate yourself to Him (i.e. the offering of Maghrib and ‘Ishâ’ prayers), and glorify Him a long night through (i.e. Tahajjud prayer).
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَيۡلٗا طَوِيلًا

data.price: 27. Verily, these (disbelievers) love the present life of this world, and put behind them a heavy Day (that will be hard).
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمۡ يَوۡمٗا ثَقِيلٗا

data.price: 28. It is We Who created them, and We have made them of strong built. And when We will, We can replace them with others like them with a complete replacement.
data.arabic: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَآ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَآ أَمۡثَٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِيلًا

data.price: 29. Verily, this (Verse of the Qur’ân) is an admonition, so whosoever wills, let him take a Path to his Lord (Allâh).
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا

data.price: 30. But you cannot will, unless Allâh wills. Verily, Allâh is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمٗا

data.price: 31. He will admit to His Mercy whom He wills and as for the Zâlimûn - (polytheists, wrong-doers) He has prepared a painful torment.
data.arabic: يُدۡخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِي رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِيمَۢا

data.price: 1. By the winds (or angels or the Messengers of Allâh) sent forth one after another.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمُرۡسَلَٰتِ عُرۡفٗا

data.price: 2. And by the winds that blow violently.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡعَٰصِفَٰتِ عَصۡفٗا

data.price: 3. And by the winds that scatter clouds and rain.
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰشِرَٰتِ نَشۡرٗا

data.price: 4. And by the Verses (of the Qur’ân) that separate the right from the wrong.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡفَٰرِقَٰتِ فَرۡقٗا

data.price: 5. And by the angels that bring the revelations to the Messengers,
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُلۡقِيَٰتِ ذِكۡرًا

data.price: 6. To cut off all excuses or to warn.
data.arabic: عُذۡرًا أَوۡ نُذۡرًا

data.price: 7. Surely, what you are promised must come to pass.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٞ

data.price: 8. Then when the stars lose their lights.
data.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتۡ

data.price: 9. And when the heaven is cleft asunder.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتۡ

data.price: 10. And when the mountains are blown away.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ نُسِفَتۡ

data.price: 11. And when the Messengers are gathered to their time appointed.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتۡ

data.price: 12. For what Day are these signs postponed?
data.arabic: لِأَيِّ يَوۡمٍ أُجِّلَتۡ

data.price: 13. For the Day of Sorting Out (the men of Paradise from the men destined for Hell).
data.arabic: لِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ

data.price: 14. And what will explain to you what is the Day of Sorting Out?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ

data.price: 15. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 16. Did We not destroy the ancients?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نُهۡلِكِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: 17. So shall We make later generations to follow them.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ نُتۡبِعُهُمُ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: 18. Thus do We deal with the Mujrimûn (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals).
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفۡعَلُ بِٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: 19. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 20. Did We not create you from a despised water (semen)?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَخۡلُقكُّم مِّن مَّآءٖ مَّهِينٖ

data.price: 21. Then We placed it in a place of safety (womb),
data.arabic: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ فِي قَرَارٖ مَّكِينٍ

data.price: 22. For a known period (determined by gestation)?
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ

data.price: 23. So We did measure; and We are the Best to measure (the things).
data.arabic: فَقَدَرۡنَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡقَٰدِرُونَ

data.price: 24. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 25. Have We not made the earth a receptacle
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ كِفَاتًا

data.price: 26. For the living and the dead?
data.arabic: أَحۡيَآءٗ وَأَمۡوَٰتٗا

data.price: 27. And have placed therein firm, and tall mountains, and have given you to drink sweet water?
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ شَٰمِخَٰتٖ وَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُم مَّآءٗ فُرَاتٗا

data.price: 28. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 29. (It will be said to the disbelievers): "Depart you to that which you used to deny!
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: 30. "Depart you to a shadow (of Hell-Fire smoke ascending) in three columns,
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ ظِلّٖ ذِي ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٖ

data.price: 31. Neither shady, nor of any use against the fierce flame of the Fire."
data.arabic: لَّا ظَلِيلٖ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ

data.price: 32. Verily, it (Hell) throws sparks (huge) as Al-Qasr (a fort or a huge log of wood),
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا تَرۡمِي بِشَرَرٖ كَٱلۡقَصۡرِ

data.price: 33. As if they were yellow camels or bundles of ropes.
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَٰلَتٞ صُفۡرٞ

data.price: 34. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 35. That will be a Day when they shall not speak (during some part of it),
data.arabic: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ لَا يَنطِقُونَ

data.price: 36. And they will not be permitted to put forth any excuse.
data.arabic: وَلَا يُؤۡذَنُ لَهُمۡ فَيَعۡتَذِرُونَ

data.price: 37. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 38. That will be a Day of Decision! We have brought you and the men of old together!
data.arabic: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِۖ جَمَعۡنَٰكُمۡ وَٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: 39. So if you have a plot, use it against Me (Allâh جل جلاله)!
data.arabic: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمۡ كَيۡدٞ فَكِيدُونِ

data.price: 40. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 41. Verily, the Muttaqûn (the pious. See V.2:2) shall be amidst shades and springs.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي ظِلَٰلٖ وَعُيُونٖ

data.price: 42. And fruits, such as they desire.
data.arabic: وَفَوَٰكِهَ مِمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ

data.price: 43. "Eat and drink comfortably for that which you used to do."
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: 44. Verily, thus We reward the Muhsinûn (good-doers. See V.2:112).
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: 45. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 46. (O you disbelievers)! Eat and enjoy yourselves (in this worldly life) for a little while. Verily, you are the Mujrimûn (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals).
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَتَمَتَّعُواْ قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجۡرِمُونَ

data.price: 47. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 48. And when it is said to them: "Bow down yourself (in prayer)!" They bow not down (offer not their prayers).[1]
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُواْ لَا يَرۡكَعُونَ
data.footnotes:
(V.77:48)
A) Narrated Anas bin Mâlik رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "I have been ordered to fight the people till they say: Lâ ilâha illallâh (none has the right to be worshipped but Allâh). And if they say so, perform As-Salât (the prayer) like our Salât (prayers), face our Qîblah and slaughter as we slaughter, then their blood and property will be sacred to us and we will not interfere with them except legally and their reckoning will be with Allâh."
Narrated Maimûn bin Siyâh that he asked Anas bin Mâlik, "O Abu Hamzah! What makes the life and property of a person sacred?" He replied, "Whoever says, Lâ ilâha illallâh (none has the right to be worshipped but Allâh), faces our Qîblah during the Salât (prayers), perform As-Salât (the prayer) like us, and eat our slaughtered animals then he is a Muslim and has got the same rights and obligations as other Muslims have." (Sahih Al Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadith No.387).
B) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "If the people knew (the reward for) pronouncing the Adhân and for standing in the first row (in congregational prayers) and found no other way to get that except by drawing lots they would draw lots, and if they knew (the reward of) the Zuhr prayer (in the early moments of its stated time) they would race for it (go early) and if they knew (the reward of) ‘Ishâ and Fajr (night and morning) prayers in congregation, they would come to offer them even if they had to crawl." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 1, Hadith No.589).

data.price: 49. Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 50. Then in what statement after this (the Qur’ân) will they believe?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثِۭ بَعۡدَهُۥ يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: 1. What are they asking (one another) about?
data.arabic: عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: 2. About the great news, (i.e. Islâmic Monotheism, the Qur’ân, which Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم brought and the Day of Resurrection)
data.arabic: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: 3. About which they are in disagreement.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي هُمۡ فِيهِ مُخۡتَلِفُونَ

data.price: 4. Nay, they will come to know!
data.arabic: كَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: 5. Nay, again, they will come to know!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: 6. Have We not made the earth as a bed,
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ مِهَٰدٗا

data.price: 7. And the mountains as pegs?
data.arabic: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَوۡتَادٗا

data.price: 8. And We have created you in pairs (male and female, tall and short, good and bad, etc.).
data.arabic: وَخَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا

data.price: 9. And We have made your sleep as a thing for rest.
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا نَوۡمَكُمۡ سُبَاتٗا

data.price: 10. And We have made the night as a covering (through its darkness),
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلَّيۡلَ لِبَاسٗا

data.price: 11. And We have made the day for livelihood.
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشٗا

data.price: 12. And We have built above you seven strong (heavens),
data.arabic: وَبَنَيۡنَا فَوۡقَكُمۡ سَبۡعٗا شِدَادٗا

data.price: 13. And We have made (therein) a shining lamp (sun).
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا سِرَاجٗا وَهَّاجٗا

data.price: 14. And We have sent down from the rainy clouds abundant water.
data.arabic: وَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُعۡصِرَٰتِ مَآءٗ ثَجَّاجٗا

data.price: 15. That We may produce therewith corn and vegetations,
data.arabic: لِّنُخۡرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبّٗا وَنَبَاتٗا

data.price: 16. And gardens of thick growth.
data.arabic: وَجَنَّٰتٍ أَلۡفَافًا

data.price: 17. Verily, the Day of Decision is a fixed time,
data.arabic: إِنَّ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ كَانَ مِيقَٰتٗا

data.price: 18. The Day when the Trumpet will be blown, and you shall come forth in crowds (groups after groups). [Tafsir At-Tabari]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُنفَخُ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأۡتُونَ أَفۡوَاجٗا

data.price: 19. And the heaven shall be opened, and it will become as gates,
data.arabic: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ أَبۡوَٰبٗا

data.price: 20. And the mountains shall be moved away from their places and they will be as if they were a mirage.
data.arabic: وَسُيِّرَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ فَكَانَتۡ سَرَابًا

data.price: 21. Truly, Hell is a place of ambush -
data.arabic: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتۡ مِرۡصَادٗا

data.price: 22. A dwelling place for the Tâghûn (those who transgress the boundary limits set by Allâh like polytheists, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allâh, hyprocrites, sinners, criminals),
data.arabic: لِّلطَّٰغِينَ مَـَٔابٗا

data.price: 23. They will abide therein for ages.
data.arabic: لَّٰبِثِينَ فِيهَآ أَحۡقَابٗا

data.price: 24. Nothing cool shall they taste therein, nor any drink.
data.arabic: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرۡدٗا وَلَا شَرَابًا

data.price: 25. Except boiling water, and dirty wound discharges -
data.arabic: إِلَّا حَمِيمٗا وَغَسَّاقٗا

data.price: 26. An exact recompense (according to their evil crimes).
data.arabic: جَزَآءٗ وِفَاقًا

data.price: 27. For verily, they used not to look for a reckoning.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ لَا يَرۡجُونَ حِسَابٗا

data.price: 28. But they belied Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, and that which Our Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم brought) completely.
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كِذَّابٗا

data.price: 29. And all things We have recorded in a Book.
data.arabic: وَكُلَّ شَيۡءٍ أَحۡصَيۡنَٰهُ كِتَٰبٗا

data.price: 30. So taste you (the results of your evil actions). No increase shall We give you, except in torment.
data.arabic: فَذُوقُواْ فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمۡ إِلَّا عَذَابًا

data.price: 31. Verily, for the Muttaqûn,[1] there will be a success (Paradise);
data.arabic: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا
data.footnotes: (V.78:31) Muttaqûn: means pious believer of Islamic Monotheism who fear Allâh much (abstain from all kinds of sins and evil deeds which He has forbidden) and love Allâh much (perform all kinds of good deeds which He has ordained).

data.price: 32. Gardens and vineyards,
data.arabic: حَدَآئِقَ وَأَعۡنَٰبٗا

data.price: 33. And young full-breasted (mature) maidens of equal age,
data.arabic: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتۡرَابٗا

data.price: 34. And a full cup (of wine).
data.arabic: وَكَأۡسٗا دِهَاقٗا

data.price: 35. No Laghw (dirty, false, evil talk) shall they hear therein, nor lying;
data.arabic: لَّا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا كِذَّٰبٗا

data.price: 36. A reward from your Lord, an ample calculated gift (according to the best of their good deeds),[2]
data.arabic: جَزَآءٗ مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَآءً حِسَابٗا
data.footnotes:
(V.78:36) a) Islâm demolishes all the previous evil deeds and so do migration (for Allâh’s sake) and Hajj (pilgrimage to Makkah). (Sahih Muslim, Vol.1, Chapter 52, Page 18).
b) What is said regarding the superiority of a person who embraces Islâm sincerely:
Narrated Abu Sa‘îd Al-Khudri رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "If a person embraces Islâm sincerely, then Allâh shall forgive all his past sins, and after that starts the settlement of accounts: the reward of his good deeds will be ten times to seven hundred times for each good deed, and an evil deed will be recorded as it is unless Allâh forgives it." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadith No. 40A).
Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "If any one of you improves (follows strictly) his Islâmic religion, then his good deeds will be rewarded ten times to seven hundred times for each good deed and a bad deed will be recorded as it is." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadith No. 40B).

data.price: 37. (From) the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and whatsoever is in between them, the Most Gracious, with Whom they cannot dare to speak (on the Day of Resurrection except by His Leave).
data.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِۖ لَا يَمۡلِكُونَ مِنۡهُ خِطَابٗا

data.price: 38. The Day that Ar-Rûh [Jibrîl (Gabriel) or another angel] and the angels will stand forth in rows, they will not speak except him whom the Most Gracious (Allâh) allows, and he will speak what is right.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ صَفّٗاۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنۡ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابٗا

data.price: 39. That is (without doubt) the True Day. So, whosoever wills, let him seek a place with (or a way to) His Lord (by obeying Him in this worldly life)!
data.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا

data.price: 40. Verily, We have warned you of a near torment - the Day when man will see that (the deeds) which his hands have sent forth, and the disbeliever will say: "Woe to me! Would that I were dust!"
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنذَرۡنَٰكُمۡ عَذَابٗا قَرِيبٗا يَوۡمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مَا قَدَّمَتۡ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلۡكَافِرُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي كُنتُ تُرَٰبَۢا

data.price: 1. By those (angels) who pull out (the souls of the disbelievers and the wicked) with great violence.
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰزِعَٰتِ غَرۡقٗا

data.price: 2. By those (angels) who gently take out (the souls of the believers).
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰشِطَٰتِ نَشۡطٗا

data.price: 3. And by those that swim along (i.e. angels or planets in their orbits).
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّٰبِحَٰتِ سَبۡحٗا

data.price: 4. And by those that press forward as in a race (i.e. the angels or stars or the horses).
data.arabic: فَٱلسَّٰبِقَٰتِ سَبۡقٗا

data.price: 5. And by those angels who arrange to do the Commands of their Lord, (so verily, you disbelievers will be called to account).
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُدَبِّرَٰتِ أَمۡرٗا

data.price: 6. On the Day (when the first blowing of the Trumpet is blown), the earth and the mountains will shake violently (and everybody will die).
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ

data.price: 7. The second blowing of the Trumpet follows it (and everybody will be resurrected).
data.arabic: تَتۡبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ

data.price: 8. (Some) hearts that Day will shake with fear and anxiety.
data.arabic: قُلُوبٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ وَاجِفَةٌ

data.price: 9. Their eyes will be downcast.
data.arabic: أَبۡصَٰرُهَا خَٰشِعَةٞ

data.price: 10. They say: "Shall we indeed be returned to (our) former state of life?
data.arabic: يَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرۡدُودُونَ فِي ٱلۡحَافِرَةِ

data.price: 11. "Even after we are crumbled bones?"
data.arabic: أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَٰمٗا نَّخِرَةٗ

data.price: 12. They say: "It would in that case, be a return with loss!"
data.arabic: قَالُواْ تِلۡكَ إِذٗا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٞ

data.price: 13. But it will be only a single Zajrah [shout (i.e., the second blowing of the Trumpet)], (See Verse 37:19).
data.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ

data.price: 14. When behold, they find themselves on the surface of the earth alive after their death,
data.arabic: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ

data.price: 15. Has there come to you the story of Mûsâ (Moses)?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰٓ

data.price: 16. When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tûwâ,
data.arabic: إِذۡ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلۡوَادِ ٱلۡمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

data.price: 17. Go to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh); verily he has transgressed all bounds (in crimes, sins, polytheism, disbelief).
data.arabic: ٱذۡهَبۡ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ

data.price: 18. And say to him: "Would you purify yourself (from the sin of disbelief by becoming a believer)?"
data.arabic: فَقُلۡ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: 19. "And that I guide you to your Lord, so you should fear Him?"
data.arabic: وَأَهۡدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: 20. Then [Mûsâ (Moses)] showed him the great sign (miracles).
data.arabic: فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلۡأٓيَةَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ

data.price: 21. But [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] belied and disobeyed.
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ

data.price: 22. Then he turned his back, striving (against Allâh).
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ يَسۡعَىٰ

data.price: 23. Then he gathered (his people) and cried aloud,
data.arabic: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ

data.price: 24. Saying: "I am your lord, most high."
data.arabic: فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

data.price: 25. So Allâh, seized him with punishment for his last[1] and first[2] transgression. [Tafsir At-Tabari]
data.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰٓ
data.footnotes:
[1] (V.79:25) Last i.e. his saying: "I am your lord, most high" (See Verse 79:24)
[2] (V.79:25) First i.e. his saying, "O chiefs! I know not that you have a god other than I" (See Verse 28:38)

data.price: 26. Verily, in this is an instructive admonition for whosoever fears Allâh.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبۡرَةٗ لِّمَن يَخۡشَىٰٓ

data.price: 27. Are you more difficult to create or is the heaven that He constructed?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُۚ بَنَىٰهَا

data.price: 28. He raised its height, and has perfected it.
data.arabic: رَفَعَ سَمۡكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا

data.price: 29. Its night He covers with darkness and its forenoon He brings out (with light)
data.arabic: وَأَغۡطَشَ لَيۡلَهَا وَأَخۡرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا

data.price: 30. And after that He spread the earth,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَىٰهَآ

data.price: 31. And brought forth therefrom its water and its pasture.
data.arabic: أَخۡرَجَ مِنۡهَا مَآءَهَا وَمَرۡعَىٰهَا

data.price: 32. And the mountains He has fixed firmly,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَرۡسَىٰهَا

data.price: 33. (To be) a provision and benefit for you and your cattle.
data.arabic: مَتَٰعٗا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَٰمِكُمۡ

data.price: 34. But when there comes the greatest catastrophe (i.e. the Day of Recompense) -
data.arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلطَّآمَّةُ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ

data.price: 35. The Day when man shall remember what he strove for.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ

data.price: 36. And Hell-fire shall be made apparent in full view for (every) one who sees.
data.arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلۡجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ

data.price: 37. Then for him who transgressed all bounds, (in disbelief, oppression and evil deeds of disobedience to Allâh).
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ

data.price: 38. And preferred the life of this world (by following his evil desires and lusts),
data.arabic: وَءَاثَرَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا

data.price: 39. Verily, his abode will be Hell-fire;
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ هِيَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ

data.price: 40. But as for him who feared standing before his Lord, and restrained himself from impure evil desires and lusts.
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفۡسَ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ

data.price: 41. Verily, Paradise will be his abode.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ هِيَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ

data.price: 42. They ask you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) about the Hour - when will be its appointed time?
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرۡسَىٰهَا

data.price: 43. You have no knowledge to say anything about it.
data.arabic: فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكۡرَىٰهَآ

data.price: 44. To your Lord belongs (the knowledge of) the term thereof?
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَآ

data.price: 45. You (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) are only a warner for those who fear it,
data.arabic: إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخۡشَىٰهَا

data.price: 46. The Day they see it, (it will be) as if they had not tarried (in this world) except an afternoon or a morning.
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُمۡ يَوۡمَ يَرَوۡنَهَا لَمۡ يَلۡبَثُوٓاْ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوۡ ضُحَىٰهَا

data.price: 1. (The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم) frowned and turned away.
data.arabic: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ

data.price: 2. Because there came to him the blind man (i.e. ‘Abdullâh bin Umm-Maktûm, who came to the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم while he was preaching to one or some of the Quraish chiefs).
data.arabic: أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلۡأَعۡمَىٰ

data.price: 3. And how can you know that he might become pure (from sins)?
data.arabic: وَمَا يُدۡرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ يَزَّكَّىٰٓ

data.price: 4. Or he might receive admonition, and the admonition might profit him?
data.arabic: أَوۡ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰٓ

data.price: 5. As for him who thinks himself self-sufficient,
data.arabic: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ

data.price: 6. To him you attend;
data.arabic: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ

data.price: 7. What does it matter to you if he will not become pure (from disbelief: you are only a Messenger, your duty is to convey the Message of Allâh).
data.arabic: وَمَا عَلَيۡكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ

data.price: 8. But as to him who came to you running,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسۡعَىٰ

data.price: 9. And is afraid (of Allâh and His punishment).
data.arabic: وَهُوَ يَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: 10. Of him you are neglectful and divert your attention to another,
data.arabic: فَأَنتَ عَنۡهُ تَلَهَّىٰ

data.price: 11. Nay, (do not do like this); indeed it (this Qur’ân) is an admonition.
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا تَذۡكِرَةٞ

data.price: 12. So whoever wills, let him pay attention to it.
data.arabic: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ

data.price: 13. (It is) in Records held (greatly) in honour (Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz),
data.arabic: فِي صُحُفٖ مُّكَرَّمَةٖ

data.price: 14. Exalted (in dignity), purified,
data.arabic: مَّرۡفُوعَةٖ مُّطَهَّرَةِۭ

data.price: 15. In the hands of scribes (angels).
data.arabic: بِأَيۡدِي سَفَرَةٖ

data.price: 16. Honourable and obedient.
data.arabic: كِرَامِۭ بَرَرَةٖ

data.price: 17. Be cursed (the disbelieving) man! How ungrateful he is!
data.arabic: قُتِلَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَآ أَكۡفَرَهُۥ

data.price: 18. From what thing did He create him?
data.arabic: مِنۡ أَيِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ

data.price: 19. From Nutfah (male and female semen drops) He created him and then set him in due proportion.
data.arabic: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ

data.price: 20. Then He makes the Path easy for him.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُۥ

data.price: 21. Then He causes him to die and puts him in his grave.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقۡبَرَهُۥ

data.price: 22. Then when it is His Will, He will resurrect him (again).
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَآءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ

data.price: 23. Nay, but (man) has not done what He commanded him.
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقۡضِ مَآ أَمَرَهُۥ

data.price: 24. Then let man look at his food:
data.arabic: فَلۡيَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦٓ

data.price: 25. We pour forth water in abundance.
data.arabic: أَنَّا صَبَبۡنَا ٱلۡمَآءَ صَبّٗا

data.price: 26. And We split the earth in clefts.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ شَقَقۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ شَقّٗا

data.price: 27. And We cause therein the grain to grow,
data.arabic: فَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا حَبّٗا

data.price: 28. And grapes and clover plants (i.e. green fodder for the cattle),
data.arabic: وَعِنَبٗا وَقَضۡبٗا

data.price: 29. And olives and date-palms,
data.arabic: وَزَيۡتُونٗا وَنَخۡلٗا

data.price: 30. And gardens dense with many trees,
data.arabic: وَحَدَآئِقَ غُلۡبٗا

data.price: 31. And fruits and herbage
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٗ وَأَبّٗا

data.price: 32. (To be) a provision and benefit for you and your cattle.
data.arabic: مَّتَٰعٗا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَٰمِكُمۡ

data.price: 33. Then when there comes As-Sâkhkhah (the second blowing of the Trumpet on the Day of Resurrection)
data.arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلصَّآخَّةُ

data.price: 34. That Day shall a man flee from his brother,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَفِرُّ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مِنۡ أَخِيهِ

data.price: 35. And from his mother and his father,
data.arabic: وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِيهِ

data.price: 36. And from his wife and his children.
data.arabic: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِيهِ

data.price: 37. Everyman that Day will have enough to make him careless of others.
data.arabic: لِكُلِّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ شَأۡنٞ يُغۡنِيهِ

data.price: 38. Some faces that Day will be bright (true believers of Islâmic Monotheism),
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ مُّسۡفِرَةٞ

data.price: 39. Laughing, rejoicing at good news (of Paradise).
data.arabic: ضَاحِكَةٞ مُّسۡتَبۡشِرَةٞ

data.price: 40. And other faces, that Day, will be dust-stained.
data.arabic: وَوُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٍ عَلَيۡهَا غَبَرَةٞ

data.price: 41. Darkness will cover them.
data.arabic: تَرۡهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ

data.price: 42. Such will be the Kafarah (disbelievers in Allâh, in His Oneness, and in His Messenger Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم, etc.), the Fajarah (wicked evil doers).
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡكَفَرَةُ ٱلۡفَجَرَةُ

data.price: 1. When the sun is wound round and its light is lost and is overthrown.[1]
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلشَّمۡسُ كُوِّرَتۡ
data.footnotes: (V.81:1) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The sun and the moon will be folded up (or joined together or deprived of their lights) on the Day of Resurrection." [See the Qur’ân (V.75:9)] (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.4, Hadith No.422).

data.price: 2. And when the stars fall.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتۡ

data.price: 3. And when the mountains are made to pass away;
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتۡ

data.price: 4. And when the pregnant she-camels are neglected;
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتۡ

data.price: 5. And when the wild beasts are gathered together.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتۡ

data.price: 6. And when the seas become as blazing Fire or overflow.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتۡ

data.price: 7. And when the souls are joined with their bodies, (the good with the good and the bad with the bad).
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتۡ

data.price: 8. And when the female (infant) buried alive (as the pagan Arabs used to do) is questioned:[2]
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡمَوۡءُۥدَةُ سُئِلَتۡ
data.footnotes: (V.81:8) Narrated Al-Mughîrah bin Shu‘bah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Allâh has forbidden for you: (1) to be undutiful to your mothers, (2) to bury your daughters alive, (3) not to pay the rights of the others (e.g., charity), and (4) to beg of men (i.e., begging). And Allâh hates for you: (1) sinful and useless talk like backbiting, or that you talk too much about others, (2) to ask too many questions (in disputed religious matters), and (3) to waste the wealth (by extravagance with lack of wisdom and thinking)." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.3, Hadith No.591).

data.price: 9. For what sin, was she killed?
data.arabic: بِأَيِّ ذَنۢبٖ قُتِلَتۡ

data.price: 10. And when the (written) pages [of deeds (good and bad) of every person] are laid open.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتۡ

data.price: 11. And when the heaven is stripped off and taken away from its place;
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ كُشِطَتۡ

data.price: 12. And when Hell-fire is set ablaze.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتۡ

data.price: 13. And when Paradise is brought near.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَنَّةُ أُزۡلِفَتۡ

data.price: 14. (Then) every person will know what he has brought (of good and evil).
data.arabic: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّآ أَحۡضَرَتۡ

data.price: 15. So verily, I swear by the planets that recede (i.e. disappear during the day and appear during the night).
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلۡخُنَّسِ

data.price: 16. And by the planets that move swiftly and hide themselves.
data.arabic: ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡكُنَّسِ

data.price: 17. And by the night as it departs.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا عَسۡعَسَ

data.price: 18. And by the dawn as it brightens.
data.arabic: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ

data.price: 19. Verily, this is the Word (this Qur’ân brought by) a most honourable messenger [Jibrîl (Gabrîl), from Allâh to Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم].
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولٖ كَرِيمٖ

data.price: 20. Owner of power, (and high rank) with (Allâh), the Lord of the Throne,
data.arabic: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِينٖ

data.price: 21. Obeyed (by the angels in the heavens), and trustworthy.
data.arabic: مُّطَاعٖ ثَمَّ أَمِينٖ

data.price: 22. And (O people) your companion (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is not a madman.
data.arabic: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجۡنُونٖ

data.price: 23. And indeed he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) saw him [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] in the clear horizon (towards the east).
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡمُبِينِ

data.price: 24. And he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) withholds not a knowledge of the Unseen.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلۡغَيۡبِ بِضَنِينٖ

data.price: 25. And it (the Qur’ân) is not the word of the outcast Shaitân (Satan).
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَيۡطَٰنٖ رَّجِيمٖ

data.price: 26. Then where are you going?
data.arabic: فَأَيۡنَ تَذۡهَبُونَ

data.price: 27. Verily, this (the Qur’ân) is no less than a Reminder to (all) the ‘Âlamîn (mankind and jinn)[3]
data.arabic: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes:
(V.81:27)
a) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "There was no Prophet among the Prophets but was given miracles because of which people had security or had belief, but what I have been given is the Divine Revelation which Allâh has revealed to me. So I hope that my followers will be more than those of any other Prophet on the Day of Resurrection." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.9, Hadith No.379)
b) It is obligatory to have Belief in the Messengership of the Prophet (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم).
Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "By Him (Allâh) in Whose Hand Muhammad’s soul is, there is none from amongst the Jews and Christians (of these present nations) who hears about me and then dies without believing in the Message with which I have been sent (i.e. Islâmic Monotheism), but he will be from the dwellers of the (Hell) Fire." (Sahih Muslim , the Book of Faith, Vol.1, Chapter No.240). See also (V.3:85) and (V.3:116).

data.price: 28. To whomsoever among you who wills to walk straight.
data.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَسۡتَقِيمَ

data.price: 29. And you cannot will unless (it be) that Allâh wills - the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: 1. When the heaven is cleft asunder.
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتۡ

data.price: 2. And when the stars have fallen and scattered.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتۡ

data.price: 3. And when the seas are burst forth.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتۡ

data.price: 4. And when the graves are turned upside down (and bring out their contents)
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡقُبُورُ بُعۡثِرَتۡ

data.price: 5. (Then) a person will know what he has sent forward and (what he has) left behind (of good or bad deeds).
data.arabic: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّا قَدَّمَتۡ وَأَخَّرَتۡ

data.price: 6. O man! What has made you careless about your Lord, the Most Generous?
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلۡكَرِيمِ

data.price: 7. Who created you, fashioned you perfectly, and gave you due proportion.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ

data.price: 8. In whatever form He willed, He put you together.
data.arabic: فِيٓ أَيِّ صُورَةٖ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ

data.price: 9. Nay! But you deny Ad-Dîn (i.e. the Day of Recompense).
data.arabic: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 10. But verily, over you (are appointed angels in charge of mankind) to watch you,[1]
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيۡكُمۡ لَحَٰفِظِينَ
data.footnotes: (V.82:10) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "Angels come (to you) in succession by night and day, and all of them get together at the time of the Fajr and ‘Asr prayers. Then those who have stayed with you overnight, ascend unto Allâh, Who asks them (and He knows the answer better than they): "How have you left My slaves?" They reply, "We left them while they were praying and we came to them while they were praying". The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم added: "If anyone of you says Amîn (during the prayer at the end of the recitation of Sûrat Al-Fâtihah), and the angels in heaven say the same, and the two sayings coincide, all his past sins will be forgiven". (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.4, Hadith No.446).

data.price: 11. Kirâman (Honourable) Kâtibîn writing down (your deeds),[2]
data.arabic: كِرَامٗا كَٰتِبِينَ
data.footnotes:
(V.82:11) Whoever intended to do a good deed or a bad deed.
Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم narrating about his Lord عز وجل said, "Allâh ordered (the angels appointed over you) that the good and the bad deeds be written, and He then showed (the way) how (to write). If somebody intends to do a good deed and he does not do it, then Allâh will write for him a full good deed (in his account with Him); and if he intends to do a good deed and actually does it, then Allâh will write for him (in his account) with Him (its reward equal) from ten to seven hundred times, to many more times; and if somebody intends to do a bad deed and he does not do it, then Allâh will write a full good deed (in his account) with Him, and if he intends to do it (a bad deed) and actually does it, then Allâh will write one bad deed (in his account)." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.8, Hadith No.498).

data.price: 12. They know all that you do.
data.arabic: يَعۡلَمُونَ مَا تَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: 13. Verily, the Abrâr (the pious believers of Islamic Monotheism) will be in Delight (Paradise);
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٖ

data.price: 14. And verily, the Fujjâr (the wicked, disbelievers, polytheists, sinners and evil-doers) will be in the blazing Fire (Hell),
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلۡفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٖ

data.price: 15. Therein they will enter, and taste its burning flame on the Day of Recompense,
data.arabic: يَصۡلَوۡنَهَا يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 16. And they (Al-Fujjâr) will not be absent therefrom.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا بِغَآئِبِينَ

data.price: 17. And what will make you know what the Day of Recompense is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 18. Again, what will make you know what the Day of Recompense is?
data.arabic: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 19. (It will be) the Day when no person shall have power (to do) anything for another, and the Decision, that Day, will be (wholly) with Allâh.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ لَا تَمۡلِكُ نَفۡسٞ لِّنَفۡسٖ شَيۡـٔٗاۖ وَٱلۡأَمۡرُ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلَّهِ

data.price: 1. Woe to Al-Mutaffifûn (those who give less in measure and weight).
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ لِّلۡمُطَفِّفِينَ

data.price: 2. Those who, when they have to receive by measure from men, demand full measure,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكۡتَالُواْ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسۡتَوۡفُونَ

data.price: 3. And when they have to give by measure or weight to (other) men, give less than due.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمۡ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمۡ يُخۡسِرُونَ

data.price: 4. Do they not think that they will be resurrected (for reckoning),
data.arabic: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبۡعُوثُونَ

data.price: 5. On a Great Day?
data.arabic: لِيَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: 6. The Day when (all) mankind will stand before the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists)?
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: 7. Nay! Truly, the Record (writing of the deeds) of the Fujjâr (disbelievers, polytheists, sinners, evil-doers and the wicked) is (preserved) in Sijjîn.
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلۡفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٖ

data.price: 8. And what will make you know what Sijjîn is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّينٞ

data.price: 9. A Register inscribed.
data.arabic: كِتَٰبٞ مَّرۡقُومٞ

data.price: 10. Woe, that Day, to those who deny.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: 11. Those who deny the Day of Recompense.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 12. And none can deny it except every transgressor beyond bounds, (in disbelief, oppression and disobedience to Allâh) the sinner!
data.arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعۡتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ

data.price: 13. When Our Verses (of the Qur’ân) are recited to him he says: "Tales of the ancients!"
data.arabic: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: 14. Nay! But on their hearts is the Rân (covering of sins and evil deeds) which they used to earn.[1]
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَلۡۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُواْ يَكۡسِبُونَ
data.footnotes: (V.83:14) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "When a slave (a person) commits a sin (an evil deed) a black dot is dotted on his heart. Then if that person gives up that evil deed (sin), begs Allâh to forgive him, and repents, then his heart is cleared (from that heart covering dot); but if he repeats the evil deed (sin), then that covering is increased till his heart is completely covered with it. And that is Ar-Rân which Allâh mentioned (in the Qur’ân), "Nay! but on their hearts is the Rân (covering of sins and evil deeds) which they used to earn." (At-Tirmidhi, Vol.5, Hadith No.3334).

data.price: 15. Nay! Surely they (evil-doers) will be veiled from seeing their Lord that Day.
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمۡ عَن رَّبِّهِمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّمَحۡجُوبُونَ

data.price: 16. Then, verily, they will indeed enter (and taste) the burning flame of Hell.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمۡ لَصَالُواْ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: 17. Then, it will be said to them: "This is what you used to deny!"
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: 18. Nay! Verily, the Record (writing of the deeds) of Al-Abrâr (the pious believers of Islamic Monotheism) is (preserved) in ‘Illiyyûn
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ

data.price: 19. And what will make you know what ‘Illiyyûn is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ

data.price: 20. A Register inscribed,
data.arabic: كِتَٰبٞ مَّرۡقُومٞ

data.price: 21. To which bear witness those nearest (to Allâh, i.e. the angels).
data.arabic: يَشۡهَدُهُ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: 22. Verily, Al-Abrâr (the pious believers of Islamic Monotheism) will be in Delight (Paradise).
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ

data.price: 23. On thrones, looking (at all things).
data.arabic: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ

data.price: 24. You will recognise in their faces the brightness of delight.
data.arabic: تَعۡرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمۡ نَضۡرَةَ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: 25. They will be given to drink of pure sealed wine.
data.arabic: يُسۡقَوۡنَ مِن رَّحِيقٖ مَّخۡتُومٍ

data.price: 26. The last thereof (that wine) will be the smell of Musk, and for this let (all) those strive who want to strive (i.e. hasten earnestly to the obedience of Allah).
data.arabic: خِتَٰمُهُۥ مِسۡكٞۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلۡيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلۡمُتَنَٰفِسُونَ

data.price: 27. It (that wine) will be mixed with Tasnîm:
data.arabic: وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسۡنِيمٍ

data.price: 28. A spring whereof drink those nearest to Allâh.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: 29. Verily, (during the worldly life) those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجۡرَمُواْ كَانُواْ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ يَضۡحَكُونَ

data.price: 30. And, whenever they passed by them, used to wink one to another (in mockery).
data.arabic: وَإِذَا مَرُّواْ بِهِمۡ يَتَغَامَزُونَ

data.price: 31. And when they returned to their own people, they would return jesting;
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓاْ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُواْ فَكِهِينَ

data.price: 32. And when they saw them, they said: "Verily these have indeed gone astray!"
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡهُمۡ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ

data.price: 33. But they (disbelievers, sinners) had not been sent as watchers over them (the believers).
data.arabic: وَمَآ أُرۡسِلُواْ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَٰفِظِينَ

data.price: 34. But this Day (the Day of Resurrection) those who believe will laugh at the disbelievers[2]
data.arabic: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡكُفَّارِ يَضۡحَكُونَ
data.footnotes: (V.83:34) Narrated Anas bin Mâlik رضي الله عنه: A man said, "O Allâh’s Prophet! Will Allâh gather a disbeliever (prone) on his face on the Day of Resurrection?" He صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Will not the One Who made him walk on his feet in this world, be able to make him walk on his face on the Day of Resurrection?" (Qatâdah, a subnarrator, said: "Yes, By the Power of Our Lord!") (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadith No.283).

data.price: 35. On (high) thrones, looking (at all things).
data.arabic: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ

data.price: 36. Are not the disbelievers paid (fully) for what they used to do?
data.arabic: هَلۡ ثُوِّبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُواْ يَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: 1. When the heaven is split asunder,
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتۡ

data.price: 2. And listens to and obeys its Lord - and it must do so.
data.arabic: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ

data.price: 3. And when the earth is stretched forth,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مُدَّتۡ

data.price: 4. And has cast out all that was in it and became empty.
data.arabic: وَأَلۡقَتۡ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتۡ

data.price: 5. And listens to and obeys its Lord - and it must do so.
data.arabic: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ

data.price: 6. O man! Verily, you are returning towards your Lord with your deeds and actions (good or bad), a sure returning, and you will meet (the results of your deeds which you did).
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدۡحٗا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ

data.price: 7. Then as for him who will be given his Record in his right hand,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ

data.price: 8. He surely will receive an easy reckoning,
data.arabic: فَسَوۡفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابٗا يَسِيرٗا

data.price: 9. And will return to his family in joy!
data.arabic: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورٗا

data.price: 10. But whosoever is given his Record behind his back,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهۡرِهِۦ

data.price: 11. He will invoke (for his) destruction,
data.arabic: فَسَوۡفَ يَدۡعُواْ ثُبُورٗا

data.price: 12. And he shall enter a blazing Fire, and be made to taste its burning.
data.arabic: وَيَصۡلَىٰ سَعِيرًا

data.price: 13. Verily, he was among his people in joy!
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِيٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورًا

data.price: 14. Verily, he thought that he would never come back (to Us)!
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ

data.price: 15. Yes! Verily, his Lord has been ever beholding him!
data.arabic: بَلَىٰٓۚ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرٗا

data.price: 16. So I swear by the afterglow of sunset;
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ

data.price: 17. And by the night and whatever it gathers in its darkness,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ

data.price: 18. And by the moon when it is at the full.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ

data.price: 19. You shall certainly travel from stage to stage (in this life and in the Hereafter).
data.arabic: لَتَرۡكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٖ

data.price: 20. What is the matter with them, that they believe not?
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُمۡ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: 21. And when the Qur’ân is recited to them, they fall not prostrate.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ لَا يَسۡجُدُونَۤ۩

data.price: 22. Nay, those who disbelieve belie (Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم and whatever he brought, i.e. this Qur’ân and Islâmic Monotheism, etc.).[1]
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ يُكَذِّبُونَ
data.footnotes: (V.84:22) It is obligatory to have Belief in the Messengership of the Prophet (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم). Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه : Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "By Him (Allâh) in Whose Hand Muhammad’s soul is, there is none from amongst the Jews and Christians (of these present nations) who hears about me and then dies without believing in the Message with which I have been sent (i.e. Islâmic Monotheism), but he will be from the dwellers of the (Hell) Fire." (Sahih Muslim, the Book of Faith, Vol. 1, Chapter No.240). See also (V.3:85) and (V.3:116).

data.price: 23. And Allâh knows best what they gather (of good and bad deeds),
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ

data.price: 24. So announce to them a painful torment.
data.arabic: فَبَشِّرۡهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ

data.price: 25. Save those who believe and do righteous good deeds, for them is a reward that will never come to an end (i.e. Paradise).
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونِۭ

data.price: 1. By the heaven holding the big stars.[1]
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡبُرُوجِ
data.footnotes:
(V.85:1) (About the) Stars, Abu Qatâdah mentioning Allâh’s Statement:
"And We have adorned the nearest heaven with lamps," and said, "The creation of these stars is for three purposes, i.e., as decoration of the heaven, as missiles to hit the devils, and as signs to guide travellers. So, if anybody tries to find a different interpretation, he is mistaken and just wastes his efforts, and troubles himself with what is beyond his limited knowledge." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.4, Chapter 3).

data.price: 2. And by the Promised Day (i.e. the Day of Resurrection).
data.arabic: وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡمَوۡعُودِ

data.price: 3. And by the Witnessing day (i.e. Friday), and by the Witnessed day [i.e. the day of ‘Arafât (Hajj) the ninth of Dhul-Hijjah];
data.arabic: وَشَاهِدٖ وَمَشۡهُودٖ

data.price: 4. Cursed were the people of the Ditch (in the story of the Boy and the King).[2]
data.arabic: قُتِلَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡأُخۡدُودِ
data.footnotes:
(V.85:4) The Story of the Boy and the King.
Narrated Shu‘aib رضي الله عنه : Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "Among the people before you, there was a king and he had a sorcerer. When the sorcerer became old, he said to the king: ‘I have now become an old man, get me a boy so that I may teach him sorcery.’ So the king sent him a boy to teach him sorcery. Whenever the boy proceeded to the sorcerer, he sat with a monk who was on the way and listened to his talks and used to admire them (those talks). So when he went to the sorcerer, he passed by the monk and sat there with him. And on visiting the sorcerer, the latter thrashed him. So the boy complained about that to the monk. The monk said to him: Whenever you are afraid of the sorcerer, say to him: ‘My people kept me busy’; and whenever you are afraid of your people, say to them: ‘The sorcerer kept me busy.’ So the boy carried on like that (for a period).
"There came (on the main road) a huge creature (animal), and the people were unable to pass by. The boy said: ‘Today I will know whether the sorcerer is better or the monk’. So he took a stone and said: ‘O Allâh! If the deeds and actions of the monk are liked by You better than those of the sorcerer, then kill this creature so that the people can cross (the road).’ Then he hit (it) with the stone, and it was killed and the people passed (the road). The boy came to the monk and informed him about it. The monk said to him: ‘O my son! Today you are better than I; you have achieved what I see! And you will be put to trial. And in case you are put to trial, do not inform (them) about me.’ The boy used to treat the people suffering from born-blindness, leprosy, leucoderma, and other diseases. A blind courtier of the king heard about the boy. He came and brought a number of gifts for the boy and said: ‘All these gifts are for you on condition that you cure me’. The boy said: ‘I do not cure anybody; it is only Allâh (Alone) Who cures (people). So if you believe in Allâh, and invoke Allâh, He will cure you’. He then believed in Allâh, and Allâh cured him. Later the courtier came to the king, and sat at the place where he used to sit before. The king asked him: ‘Who has given you your sight back?’ The courtier replied: ‘My Lord (Allâh)!’ The king said: ‘Have you got another lord than I?’ The courtier said: ‘My Lord and your Lord is Allâh!’ The king got hold of him and kept on tormenting him till he informed him about the boy. So the boy was brought. The king said to the boy: ‘O boy! Has your (knowledge of) sorcery reached to the extent that you cure born-blinds, lepers, leucodermic patients and do such and such?’ The boy replied: ‘I do not cure anybody; it is only Allâh (Alone) Who does cure’. Then the king got hold of him, and kept on tormenting him till he informed him about the monk. And the monk was brought, and it was said to him: ‘Give up your religion (turn apostate)!’ The monk refused to turn apostate. Then the king ordered (to be bring) a saw, and it was put in the middle of his scalp and was sawn, till he fell. cut in two pieces. Then that courtier was brought, and it was said to him: ‘Give up your religion (turn apostate)!’ The courtier refused to turn apostate. So the saw was put in the middle of his scalp, and was sawn till he fell, cut in two pieces. Then the boy was brought, and it was said to him: ‘Give up your religion (turn apostate)!’ The boy refused to turn apostate. So the king ordered some of his courtiers to take the boy to such and such a mountain saying, ‘Then ascend up the mountain with him till you reach its top, and see if he turns apostate (from his religion, well and good); otherwise throw him down from its top.’ They took him, ascended up the mountain, and the boy said: ‘O Allâh! Save me from them by anything You wish!’ So the mountain shook and all of them fell down, and the boy came walking to the king. The king asked him: ‘What did your companions do?’ The boy said: ‘Allâh has saved me from them.’ The king then ordered some of his courtiers to take the boy on board a boat into the middle of the sea, saying, ‘Then if he turns apostate (from his religion, well and good), otherwise cast him into the sea.’ So they took him, and he said: ‘O Allâh! Save me from them by anything You wish.’ So the boat capsized, and (all the accompanying courtiers) were drowned. The boy then came walking to the king. The king said: ‘What did your companions do?’ The boy replied: ‘Allâh saved me from them’, and he further said to the king: ‘You cannot kill me till you do what I command!’ The king said: ‘What is that (command of yours)?’ The boy said: ‘Gather all the people in an upland place, and fasten me to the stem (of a tree); then take an arrow from my quiver and fix it in the bow, and say: - In the Name of Allâh, the Lord of the boy, - and shoot (me). If you do that, you will kill me.’ So the king gathered the people in an upland place, and fastened the boy to the stem, took an arrow from his quiver, fixed it in the bow, and said: ‘In the Name of Allâh, the Lord of the boy’, and shot the arrow. The arrow hit the temporal region of the skull of the boy, and the boy put his hand over the temporal region of his skull at the point where the arrow hit, and then died. The people proclaimed: ‘We have believed in the Lord of the boy! We have believed in the Lord of the boy! We have believed in the Lord of the boy!’ The king came, and it was said to him: ‘That is the thing which you were afraid of. By Allâh! The thing which you were afraid of, has fallen upon you, the people have believed (in Allâh).’ So he ordered (deep) ditches to be dug at the entrances of the roads, and it was done, then fire was kindled in those ditches, and the king ordered that whoever did not turn apostate (from his religion) be cast into the ditches, and it was done. Then there came a woman with her babe. She nearly retreated back from the ditch but the babe said (spoke): ‘O mother! Be patient, you are on the Truth,’ (So she threw herself in the ditch of the fire along with her child to be with the martyrs in the Paradise)." (Sahih Muslim, Vol.4, Hadith No.7148).

data.price: 5. Of fire fed with fuel,
data.arabic: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡوَقُودِ

data.price: 6. When they sat by it (fire),
data.arabic: إِذۡ هُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا قُعُودٞ

data.price: 7. And they witnessed what they were doing against the believers (i.e. burning them).
data.arabic: وَهُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفۡعَلُونَ بِٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ شُهُودٞ

data.price: 8. And they had no fault except that they believed in Allâh, the All-Mighty, Worthy of all Praise!
data.arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُواْ مِنۡهُمۡ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤۡمِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡحَمِيدِ

data.price: 9. To Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth! And Allâh is Witness over everything.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ شَهِيدٌ

data.price: 10. Verily, those who put into trial the believing men and believing women (by torturing them and burning them), and then do not turn in repentance (to Allâh), then they will have the torment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the burning Fire.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُواْ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمۡ يَتُوبُواْ فَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ ٱلۡحَرِيقِ

data.price: 11. Verily, those who believe and do righteous good deeds, for them will be Gardens under which rivers flow (Paradise). That is the great success.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ جَنَّٰتٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡكَبِيرُ

data.price: 12. Verily, (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) the Seizure (punishment) of your Lord is severe and painful. [See V.11:102].
data.arabic: إِنَّ بَطۡشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ

data.price: 13. Verily, He it is Who begins (punishment) and repeats (punishment in the Hereafter) (or originates the creation of everything, and then repeats it on the Day of Resurrection).
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ يُبۡدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ

data.price: 14. And He is Oft-Forgiving, full of love (towards the pious who are real true believers of Islâmic Monotheism),
data.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلۡوَدُودُ

data.price: 15. Owner of the throne, the Glorious,
data.arabic: ذُو ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡمَجِيدُ

data.price: 16. (He is the) Doer of whatsoever He intends (or wills).
data.arabic: فَعَّالٞ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ

data.price: 17. Has the story reached you of the hosts,
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلۡجُنُودِ

data.price: 18. Of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) and Thamûd?
data.arabic: فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَثَمُودَ

data.price: 19. Nay! The disbelievers (persisted) in denying (Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم and his Message of Islâmic Monotheism).
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فِي تَكۡذِيبٖ

data.price: 20. And Allâh encompasses them from behind! (i.e. all their deeds are within His Knowledge, and He will requite them for their deeds).
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَآئِهِم مُّحِيطُۢ

data.price: 21. Nay! This is a Glorious Qur’ân,
data.arabic: بَلۡ هُوَ قُرۡءَانٞ مَّجِيدٞ

data.price: 22. (Inscribed) in Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz (The Preserved Tablet)!
data.arabic: فِي لَوۡحٖ مَّحۡفُوظِۭ

data.price: 1. By the heaven, and At-Târiq (the night-comer, i.e. the bright star);
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ

data.price: 2. And what will make you to know what At-Târiq (night-comer) is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ

data.price: 3. (It is) the star of piercing brightness;
data.arabic: ٱلنَّجۡمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ

data.price: 4. There is no human being but has a protector over him (or her) (i.e. angels in charge of each human being guarding him, writing his good and bad deeds)[1]
data.arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ لَّمَّا عَلَيۡهَا حَافِظٞ
data.footnotes:
(V.86:4)
a) Whoever intended to do a good deed or a bad deed:.
Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم narrating about his Lord عز وجل said, "Allâh ordered (the appointed angels over you) that the good and the bad deeds be written, and He then showed (the way) how (to write). If somebody intends to do a good deed and he does not do it, then Allâh will write for him a full good deed (in his account with Him); and if he intends to do a good deed and actually does it, then Allâh will write for him (in his account) with Him (its reward equal) from ten to seven hundred times, to many more times; and if somebody intends to do a bad deed and he does not do it, then Allâh will write a full good deed (in his account) with Him, and if he intends to do it (a bad deed) and actually does it, then Allâh will write one bad deed (in his account)." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.8, Hadith No.498)
b) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "Angels come (to you) in succession by night and day, and all of them get together at the time of the Fajr and ‘Asr prayers. Then those who have stayed with you overnight, ascend unto Allâh, Who asks them (and He knows the answer better than they): "How have you left My slaves?" They reply, "We left them while they were praying and we came to them while they were praying." The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم added: "If anyone of you says Amîn (during the prayer at the end of the recitation of Sûrat Al-Fâtihah ), and the angels in heaven say the same, and the two sayings coincide, all his past sins will be forgiven." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.4, Hadith No. 446).

data.price: 5. So let man see from what he is created!
data.arabic: فَلۡيَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ

data.price: 6. He is created from a water gushing forth,
data.arabic: خُلِقَ مِن مَّآءٖ دَافِقٖ

data.price: 7. Proceeding from between the backbone and the ribs.
data.arabic: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ ٱلصُّلۡبِ وَٱلتَّرَآئِبِ

data.price: 8. Verily, (Allâh) is Able to bring him back (to life)!
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجۡعِهِۦ لَقَادِرٞ

data.price: 9. The Day when all the secrets (deeds, prayers, fasting, etc.) will be examined (as to their truth).
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تُبۡلَى ٱلسَّرَآئِرُ

data.price: 10. Then he will have no power, nor any helper.
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٖ وَلَا نَاصِرٖ

data.price: 11. By the sky (having rain clouds) which gives rain, again and again.
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجۡعِ

data.price: 12. And the earth which splits (with the growth of trees and plants).
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدۡعِ

data.price: 13. Verily, this (the Qur’ân) is the Word that separates (the truth from falsehood, and commands strict laws for mankind to cut the roots of evil).
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلٞ فَصۡلٞ

data.price: 14. And it is not a thing for amusement.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِٱلۡهَزۡلِ

data.price: 15. Verily, they are but plotting a plot (against you O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم).
