data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ يَكِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗا

data.price: 16. And I (too) am planning a plan.
data.arabic: وَأَكِيدُ كَيۡدٗا

data.price: 17. So give a respite to the disbelievers; deal gently with them for a while.
data.arabic: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ أَمۡهِلۡهُمۡ رُوَيۡدَۢا

data.price: 1. Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most High,
data.arabic: سَبِّحِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡأَعۡلَى

data.price: 2. Who has created (everything), and then proportioned it.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

data.price: 3. And Who has measured (preordainments for everything even to be blessed or wretched); and then guided (i.e. showed mankind the right as well as the wrong paths, and guided the animals to pasture).
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ

data.price: 4. And Who brings out the pasturage,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَخۡرَجَ ٱلۡمَرۡعَىٰ

data.price: 5. And then makes it dark stubble.
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَآءً أَحۡوَىٰ

data.price: 6. We shall make you to recite (the Qur’ân), so you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) shall not forget (it),
data.arabic: سَنُقۡرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰٓ

data.price: 7. Except what Allâh may will. He knows what is apparent and what is hidden.
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعۡلَمُ ٱلۡجَهۡرَ وَمَا يَخۡفَىٰ

data.price: 8. And We shall make easy for you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) the easy way (i.e. the doing of righteous deeds).
data.arabic: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلۡيُسۡرَىٰ

data.price: 9. Therefore remind (men) in case the reminder profits (them).
data.arabic: فَذَكِّرۡ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

data.price: 10. The reminder will be received by him who fears (Allâh),
data.arabic: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: 11. But it will be avoided by the wretched,
data.arabic: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى

data.price: 12. Who will enter the great Fire (and will be made to taste its burning).
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يَصۡلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ

data.price: 13. There he will neither die (to be in rest) nor live (a good living).
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحۡيَىٰ

data.price: 14. Indeed whosoever purifies himself (by avoiding polytheism and accepting Islâmic Monotheism) shall achieve success,
data.arabic: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: 15. And remembers (glorifies) the Name of his Lord (worships none but Allâh), and prays (five compulsory prayers and Nawâfil - additional prayers).
data.arabic: وَذَكَرَ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّهِۦ فَصَلَّىٰ

data.price: 16. Nay, you prefer the life of this world,
data.arabic: بَلۡ تُؤۡثِرُونَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا

data.price: 17. Although the Hereafter is better and more lasting.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ خَيۡرٞ وَأَبۡقَىٰٓ

data.price: 18. Verily, this is in the former Scriptures -
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَفِي ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: 19. The Scriptures of Ibrâhîm (Abraham) and Mûsâ (Moses) (عليهما السلام).
data.arabic: صُحُفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ

data.price: 1. Has there come to you the narration of the overwhelming (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلۡغَٰشِيَةِ

data.price: 2. Some faces, that Day will be humiliated (in the Hell-fire, i.e. the faces of all disbelievers, Jews and Christians).[1]
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٍ خَٰشِعَةٌ
data.footnotes: (V.88:2) It is obligatory to have Belief in the Messengership of the Prophet (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم). Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "By Him (Allâh) in Whose Hand Muhammad’s soul is, there is none from amongst the Jews and Christians (of these present nations) who hears about me and then dies without believing in the Message with which I have been sent (i.e. Islâmic Monotheism), but he will be from the dwellers of the (Hell) Fire." (Sahih Muslim , the Book of Faith, Vol.1, Chapter No.240). See also the footnotes of (V.3:85) and (V.41:46).

data.price: 3. Labouring (hard in the worldly life by worshipping others besides Allâh), weary (in the Hereafter with humility and disgrace).[2]
data.arabic: عَامِلَةٞ نَّاصِبَةٞ
data.footnotes: (V.88:3) Narrated ‘Abdullâh رضي الله عنه: "The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said one statement and I said another. The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "Whoever dies while still invoking anything other than Allâh as a rival to Allâh, will enter Hell (Fire).’ And I said, ‘Whoever dies without invoking anything as a rival to Allâh, will enter Paradise.’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadith No.24).

data.price: 4. They will enter in the hot blazing Fire.
data.arabic: تَصۡلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةٗ

data.price: 5. They will be given to drink from a boiling spring,
data.arabic: تُسۡقَىٰ مِنۡ عَيۡنٍ ءَانِيَةٖ

data.price: 6. No food will there be for them but a poisonous thorny plant,
data.arabic: لَّيۡسَ لَهُمۡ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٖ

data.price: 7. Which will neither nourish nor avail against hunger.
data.arabic: لَّا يُسۡمِنُ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِن جُوعٖ

data.price: 8. (Other) faces that Day will be joyful,
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ نَّاعِمَةٞ

data.price: 9. Glad with their endeavour (for their good deeds which they did in this world, along with the true Faith of Islâmic Monotheism).[3]
data.arabic: لِّسَعۡيِهَا رَاضِيَةٞ
data.footnotes: (V.88:9) See footnote of (V.18:104).

data.price: 10. In a lofty Paradise.
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٖ

data.price: 11. Where they shall neither hear harmful speech nor falsehood.
data.arabic: لَّا تَسۡمَعُ فِيهَا لَٰغِيَةٗ

data.price: 12. Therein will be a running spring.
data.arabic: فِيهَا عَيۡنٞ جَارِيَةٞ

data.price: 13. Therein will be thrones raised high.
data.arabic: فِيهَا سُرُرٞ مَّرۡفُوعَةٞ

data.price: 14. And cups set at hand.
data.arabic: وَأَكۡوَابٞ مَّوۡضُوعَةٞ

data.price: 15. And cushions set in rows.
data.arabic: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصۡفُوفَةٞ

data.price: 16. And rich carpets (all) spread out.
data.arabic: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبۡثُوثَةٌ

data.price: 17. Do they not look at the camels, how they are created?
data.arabic: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡإِبِلِ كَيۡفَ خُلِقَتۡ

data.price: 18. And at the heaven, how it is raised?
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ كَيۡفَ رُفِعَتۡ

data.price: 19. And at the mountains, how they are rooted (and fixed firm)?
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلۡجِبَالِ كَيۡفَ نُصِبَتۡ

data.price: 20. And at the earth, how it is outspread?
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَيۡفَ سُطِحَتۡ

data.price: 21. So remind them (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) - you are only one who reminds.
data.arabic: فَذَكِّرۡ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٞ

data.price: 22. You are not a dictator over them -
data.arabic: لَّسۡتَ عَلَيۡهِم بِمُصَيۡطِرٍ

data.price: 23. Save the one who turns away and disbelieves.[4]
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
data.footnotes: (V.88:23) See footnote of (V.8:39).

data.price: 24. Then Allâh will punish him with the greatest punishment.
data.arabic: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَكۡبَرَ

data.price: 25. Verily, to Us will be their return;
data.arabic: إِنَّ إِلَيۡنَآ إِيَابَهُمۡ

data.price: 26. Then verily, for Us will be their reckoning.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا حِسَابَهُم

data.price: 1. By the dawn;
data.arabic: وَٱلۡفَجۡرِ

data.price: 2. By the ten nights (i.e. the first ten days of the month of Dhul-Hijjah)[1],
data.arabic: وَلَيَالٍ عَشۡرٖ
data.footnotes: (V.89:2) Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "No good deeds done on other days are superior to those done on these (first ten days of Dhul-Hijjah)." Then some Companions of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Not even Jihâd ?" He replied, "Not even Jihâd, except that of a man who does it by putting himself and his property in danger (for Allâh’s sake) and does not return with any of those things." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.2, Hadith No.86).

data.price: 3. And by the even and the odd (of all the creations of Allâh).[2]
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّفۡعِ وَٱلۡوَتۡرِ
data.footnotes: (V.89:3) "Even" and "Odd" is interpreted differently by different religious scholars. Some say: Even is the Day of Slaughtering of the Sacrifices, i.e. 10th of Dhul-Hijjah, and Odd is the Day of ‘Arafah (Hajj ), i.e. 9th of Dhul-Hijjah. Others say: Even is all the creatures and Odd is Allâh. Some say it is the compulsory congregational prayer, i.e. Maghrib is Witr , and the other four prayers are Shaf‘

data.price: 4. And by the night when it departs.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَسۡرِ

data.price: 5. There is indeed in them (the above oaths) sufficient proofs for men of understanding (and that, they should avoid all kinds of sins and disbeliefs)!
data.arabic: هَلۡ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٞ لِّذِي حِجۡرٍ

data.price: 6. Saw you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) not how your Lord dealt with ‘Âd (people)
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

data.price: 7. Of Iram (who were very tall) like (lofty) pillars,
data.arabic: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلۡعِمَادِ

data.price: 8. The like of which were not created in the land?
data.arabic: ٱلَّتِي لَمۡ يُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ

data.price: 9. And (with) Thamûd (people), who hewed out rocks in the valley (to make dwellings)? [3]
data.arabic: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِينَ جَابُواْ ٱلصَّخۡرَ بِٱلۡوَادِ
data.footnotes: (V.89:9) "And you hew out in the mountains, houses with great skill." [The Qur’ân, Verse 26:149].

data.price: 10. And (with) Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) who had the stakes (to torture men by binding them to the stakes)?
data.arabic: وَفِرۡعَوۡنَ ذِي ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ

data.price: 11. Who did transgress beyond bounds in the lands (in the disobedience of Allâh).
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ طَغَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ

data.price: 12. And made therein much mischief.
data.arabic: فَأَكۡثَرُواْ فِيهَا ٱلۡفَسَادَ

data.price: 13. So your Lord poured on them different kinds of severe torment.
data.arabic: فَصَبَّ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّكَ سَوۡطَ عَذَابٍ

data.price: 14. Verily, your Lord is Ever Watchful (over them).
data.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلۡمِرۡصَادِ

data.price: 15. As for man, when his Lord tries him by giving him honour and bounties, then he says (in exultation): "My Lord has honoured me."
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَكۡرَمَنِ

data.price: 16. But when He tries him by straitening his means of life, he says: "My Lord has humiliated me!"
data.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَهَٰنَنِ

data.price: 17. Nay! But you treat not the orphans with kindness and generosity (i.e. you neither treat them well, nor give them their exact right of inheritance)!
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا تُكۡرِمُونَ ٱلۡيَتِيمَ

data.price: 18. And urge not one another on the feeding of Al-Miskîn (the poor)!
data.arabic: وَلَا تَحَٰٓضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ

data.price: 19. And you devour the inheritance all with greed.
data.arabic: وَتَأۡكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكۡلٗا لَّمّٗا

data.price: 20. And you love wealth with much love.
data.arabic: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡمَالَ حُبّٗا جَمّٗا

data.price: 21. Nay! When the earth is ground to powder.
data.arabic: كَلَّآۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكّٗا دَكّٗا

data.price: 22. And your Lord comes with the angels in rows.
data.arabic: وَجَآءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلۡمَلَكُ صَفّٗا صَفّٗا

data.price: 23. And Hell will be brought near that Day. On that Day will man remember, but how will that remembrance (then) avail him?
data.arabic: وَجِاْيٓءَ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

data.price: 24. He will say: "Alas! Would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this) my life!"
data.arabic: يَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي قَدَّمۡتُ لِحَيَاتِي

data.price: 25. So on that Day none will punish as He will punish.
data.arabic: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُۥٓ أَحَدٞ

data.price: 26. And none will bind (the wicked, disbelievers and polytheists) as He will bind.
data.arabic: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُۥٓ أَحَدٞ

data.price: 27. (It will be said to the pious believers of Islamic Monotheism): "O (you) the one in (complete) rest and satisfaction!
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفۡسُ ٱلۡمُطۡمَئِنَّةُ

data.price: 28. "Come back to your Lord well-pleased (yourself) and well-pleasing (unto Him)!
data.arabic: ٱرۡجِعِيٓ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةٗ مَّرۡضِيَّةٗ

data.price: 29. "Enter you then among My (honoured) slaves,
data.arabic: فَٱدۡخُلِي فِي عِبَٰدِي

data.price: 30. "And enter you My Paradise!"
data.arabic: وَٱدۡخُلِي جَنَّتِي

data.price: 1. I swear by this city (Makkah);
data.arabic: لَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ

data.price: 2. And you are free (from sin, and to punish the enemies of Islâm on the Day of the conquest) in this city (Makkah).[1]
data.arabic: وَأَنتَ حِلُّۢ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ
data.footnotes:
(V.90:2)
a) Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما: On the day of the conquest of Makkah, Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Allâh has made this town a sanctuary. Its thorny bushes should not be cut, its game should not be chased, and its fallen things should not be picked up except by one who would announce them publicly." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.2, Hadith No. 657)
b) See the footnote of (V.2:191).

data.price: 3. And by the begetter (i.e. Adam عليه السلام) and that which he begot (i.e. his progeny).
data.arabic: وَوَالِدٖ وَمَا وَلَدَ

data.price: 4. Verily, We have created man in toil.
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِي كَبَدٍ

data.price: 5. Does he think that none can overcome him?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقۡدِرَ عَلَيۡهِ أَحَدٞ

data.price: 6. He says (boastfully): "I have wasted wealth in abundance!"
data.arabic: يَقُولُ أَهۡلَكۡتُ مَالٗا لُّبَدًا

data.price: 7. Does he think that none sees him?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّمۡ يَرَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ

data.price: 8. Have We not made for him two eyes,
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَل لَّهُۥ عَيۡنَيۡنِ

data.price: 9. And a tongue and two lips?
data.arabic: وَلِسَانٗا وَشَفَتَيۡنِ

data.price: 10. And shown him the two ways (good and evil)?
data.arabic: وَهَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلنَّجۡدَيۡنِ

data.price: 11. But he has not attempted to pass on the path that is steep (i.e. the path which will lead to goodness and success).
data.arabic: فَلَا ٱقۡتَحَمَ ٱلۡعَقَبَةَ

data.price: 12. And what will make you know the path that is steep?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡعَقَبَةُ

data.price: 13. (It is) freeing a neck (slave)[2]
data.arabic: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
data.footnotes: (V.90:13) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "Whoever frees a Muslim slave, Allâh will save all the parts of his body from the (Hell) Fire, as he has freed the body-parts of the slave." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.3, Hadith No.693).

data.price: 14. Or giving food in a day of hunger (famine),
data.arabic: أَوۡ إِطۡعَٰمٞ فِي يَوۡمٖ ذِي مَسۡغَبَةٖ

data.price: 15. To an orphan near of kin.
data.arabic: يَتِيمٗا ذَا مَقۡرَبَةٍ

data.price: 16. Or to a Miskîn (poor) cleaving to dust (out of misery).
data.arabic: أَوۡ مِسۡكِينٗا ذَا مَتۡرَبَةٖ

data.price: 17. Then he became one of those who believed (in the Islamic Monotheism) and recommended one another to perseverance and patience, and (also) recommended one another to pity and compassion.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡمَرۡحَمَةِ

data.price: 18. They are those on the Right Hand (i.e. the dwellers of Paradise),
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ

data.price: 19. But those who disbelieved in Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), they are those on the Left Hand (the dwellers of Hell).
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا هُمۡ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ

data.price: 20. The Fire will be shut over them (i.e. they will be enveloped by the Fire without any opening or window or outlet.[3]
data.arabic: عَلَيۡهِمۡ نَارٞ مُّؤۡصَدَةُۢ
data.footnotes:
(V.90:20) "Therein breathing out with deep sighs and roaring will be their portion, and therein they will hear not. **" [The Qur’ân, Verse 21:100]
**Ibn Mas‘ûd رضي الله عنه recited this Verse and then said: "When those (who are destined to remain in the Hell-fire forever) will be thrown in the Hell-fire, each of them will be put in a separate Tabût (Box) of Fire, so that he will not see anyone punished in the Hell-fire except he himself." Then Ibn Mas‘ûd recited this Verse (V.21:100). [Tafsîr Ibn Kathîr, Tabarî and Qurtubî].

data.price: 1. By the sun and its brightness.
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّمۡسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا

data.price: 2. By the moon as it follows it (the sun).
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا

data.price: 3. By the day as it shows up (the sun’s) brightness.
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا

data.price: 4. By the night as it conceals it (the sun).
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَغۡشَىٰهَا

data.price: 5. By the heaven and Him Who built it.
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا

data.price: 6. By the earth and Him Who spread it.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا

data.price: 7. By Nafs (Adam or a person or a soul), and Him Who perfected him in proportion;
data.arabic: وَنَفۡسٖ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا

data.price: 8. Then He showed him what is wrong for him and what is right for him.
data.arabic: فَأَلۡهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقۡوَىٰهَا

data.price: 9. Indeed he succeeds who purifies his ownself (i.e. obeys and performs all that Allâh ordered, by following the true Faith of Islâmic Monotheism and by doing righteous good deeds).
data.arabic: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا

data.price: 10. And indeed he fails who corrupts his ownself (i.e. disobeys what Allâh has ordered by rejecting the true Faith of Islâmic Monotheism or by following polytheism or by doing every kind of evil wicked deeds).
data.arabic: وَقَدۡ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا

data.price: 11. Thamûd (people) denied (their Prophet) through their transgression (by rejecting the true Faith of Islâmic Monotheism, and by following polytheism, and by committing every kind of sin).
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِطَغۡوَىٰهَآ

data.price: 12. When the most wicked man among them went forth (to kill the she-camel).
data.arabic: إِذِ ٱنۢبَعَثَ أَشۡقَىٰهَا

data.price: 13. But the Messenger of Allâh [Sâlih عليه السلام] said to them: "Be cautious! (Fear the evil end). That is the she-camel of Allâh! (Do not harm it) and bar it not from having its drink!"
data.arabic: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡيَٰهَا

data.price: 14. Then they denied him and they killed it. So their Lord destroyed them because of their sin, and made them equal in destruction (i.e. all grades of people, rich and poor, strong and weak, etc.)!
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا

data.price: 15. And He (Allâh) feared not the consequences thereof.
data.arabic: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقۡبَٰهَا

data.price: 1. By the night as it envelops.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَغۡشَىٰ

data.price: 2. By the day as it appears in brightness.
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ

data.price: 3. By Him Who created male and female.
data.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰٓ

data.price: 4. Certainly, your efforts and deeds are diverse (different in aims and purposes);
data.arabic: إِنَّ سَعۡيَكُمۡ لَشَتَّىٰ

data.price: 5. As for him who gives (in charity) and keeps his duty to Allâh and fears Him,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أَعۡطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ

data.price: 6. And believes in Al-Husnâ.[1]
data.arabic: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ
data.footnotes:
(V.92:6)
(A) Al-Husnâ: The Best (i.e. either Lâ ilâha illallâh none has the right to be worshipped but Allâh) or a reward from Allâh (i.e. Allâh will compensate him for what he will spend in Allâh’s Way or bless him with Paradise).
(B) See the footnote of (V.4:37).

data.price: 7. We will make smooth for him the path of ease (goodness).
data.arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡيُسۡرَىٰ

data.price: 8. But he who is greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient.[2]
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ
data.footnotes: (V.92:8) Narrated ‘Alî رضي الله عنه : We were in the company of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم and he said, "There is none among you but has his place written for him, either in Paradise or in the Hell-fire." We said, "O Allâh’s Messenger! Shall we depend (on this fact and give up work)?" He replied, "No! Carry on doing good deeds, for everybody will find easy (to do) such deeds as will lead him to his destined place." Then the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم recited: "As for him who gives (in charity) and keeps his duty to Allâh and fears Him, and believes in Al-Husnâ. We will make smooth for him the path of ease..." (V.92: 5-10) (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadith No.472).

data.price: 9. And belies Al-Husnâ (See the footnote of the Verse No.6)
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ

data.price: 10. We will make smooth for him the path for evil.
data.arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡعُسۡرَىٰ

data.price: 11. And what will his wealth avail him when he goes down (in destruction)?.
data.arabic: وَمَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ

data.price: 12. Truly! On Us is (to give) guidance.
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا لَلۡهُدَىٰ

data.price: 13. And truly, unto Us (belong) the last (Hereafter) and the first (this world).
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلۡأٓخِرَةَ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: 14. Therefore I have warned you of a blazing Fire (Hell).
data.arabic: فَأَنذَرۡتُكُمۡ نَارٗا تَلَظَّىٰ

data.price: 15. None shall enter it save the most wretched.
data.arabic: لَا يَصۡلَىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى

data.price: 16. Who denies and turns away.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: 17. And Al-Muttaqûn (the pious - See V.2:2) will be far removed from it (Hell).
data.arabic: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَتۡقَى

data.price: 18. He who spends his wealth for increase in self-purification,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يُؤۡتِي مَالَهُۥ يَتَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: 19. And who has (in mind) no favour from anyone to be paid back,
data.arabic: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعۡمَةٖ تُجۡزَىٰٓ

data.price: 20. Except to seek the Countenance of his Lord, the Most High.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَآءَ وَجۡهِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

data.price: 21. He surely will be pleased (when he enters Paradise).
data.arabic: وَلَسَوۡفَ يَرۡضَىٰ

data.price: 1. By the forenoon (after sunrise).[1]
data.arabic: وَٱلضُّحَىٰ
data.footnotes:
(V.93:1)
a) Narrated Ibn Abî Lailâ: Only Umm Hânî told us that she had seen the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم offering the Duha (Forenoon prayer). She said. "On the day of the conquest of Makkah, the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم took a bath in my house and offered eight Raka‘ât. I never saw him praying such a light prayer but he performed perfect prostrations and bowings". (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.2, Hadith No.207A).
b) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه : My friend (the Prophet) advised me to observe three things:
(1) to fast three days a month;
(2) to pray two Raka‘ât of Duha prayer (Forenoon prayer); and
(3) to pray Witr before sleeping. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.3, Hadith No.202).

data.price: 2. By the night when it darkens (and stand still).
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ

data.price: 3. Your Lord (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has neither forsaken you nor hates you.
data.arabic: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ

data.price: 4. And indeed the Hereafter is better for you than the present (life of this world).
data.arabic: وَلَلۡأٓخِرَةُ خَيۡرٞ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: 5. And verily, your Lord will give you (all good) so that you shall be well-pleased.
data.arabic: وَلَسَوۡفَ يُعۡطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرۡضَىٰٓ

data.price: 6. Did He not find you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) an orphan and gave you a refuge?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَجِدۡكَ يَتِيمٗا فَـَٔاوَىٰ

data.price: 7. And He found you unaware (of the Qur’ân, its laws, and Prophethood) and guided you?
data.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلّٗا فَهَدَىٰ

data.price: 8. And He found you poor and made you rich (self-sufficient with self-contentment)?
data.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ عَآئِلٗا فَأَغۡنَىٰ

data.price: 9. Therefore, treat not the orphan with oppression.
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقۡهَرۡ

data.price: 10. And repulse not the beggar.
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلسَّآئِلَ فَلَا تَنۡهَرۡ

data.price: 11. And proclaim the Grace of your Lord (i.e. the Prophethood and all other Graces).
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا بِنِعۡمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثۡ

data.price: 1. Have We not opened your breast for you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَشۡرَحۡ لَكَ صَدۡرَكَ

data.price: 2. And removed from you your burden.
data.arabic: وَوَضَعۡنَا عَنكَ وِزۡرَكَ

data.price: 3. Which weighed down your back?
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنقَضَ ظَهۡرَكَ

data.price: 4. And have We not raised high your fame?
data.arabic: وَرَفَعۡنَا لَكَ ذِكۡرَكَ

data.price: 5. Verily, along with every hardship is relief,
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ يُسۡرًا

data.price: 6. Verily, along with every hardship is relief (i.e. there is one hardship with two reliefs, so one hardship cannot overcome two reliefs).
data.arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ يُسۡرٗا

data.price: 7. So when you have finished (your occupation), devote yourself for Allâh’s worship.
data.arabic: فَإِذَا فَرَغۡتَ فَٱنصَبۡ

data.price: 8. And to your Lord (Alone) turn (all your) intentions and hopes.
data.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرۡغَب

data.price: 1. By the fig, and the olive.
data.arabic: وَٱلتِّينِ وَٱلزَّيۡتُونِ

data.price: 2. By Mount Sinai.
data.arabic: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ

data.price: 3. By this city of security (Makkah).[1]
data.arabic: وَهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ ٱلۡأَمِينِ
data.footnotes: (V.95:3) See footnote of (V.2:191).

data.price: 4. Verily, We created man in the best stature (mould).
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِيٓ أَحۡسَنِ تَقۡوِيمٖ

data.price: 5. Then We reduced him to the lowest of the low.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ رَدَدۡنَٰهُ أَسۡفَلَ سَٰفِلِينَ

data.price: 6. Save those who believe (in Islâmic Monotheism) and do righteous deeds. Then they shall have a reward without end (Paradise).
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونٖ

data.price: 7. Then what (or who) causes you (O disbelievers) to deny the Recompense (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)?
data.arabic: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعۡدُ بِٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 8. Is not Allâh the Best of judges?
data.arabic: أَلَيۡسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَحۡكَمِ ٱلۡحَٰكِمِينَ

data.price: 1. Read! In the Name of your Lord Who has created (all that exists).
data.arabic: ٱقۡرَأۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ

data.price: 2. He has created man from a clot (a piece of thick coagulated blood).
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِنۡ عَلَقٍ

data.price: 3. Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous.
data.arabic: ٱقۡرَأۡ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلۡأَكۡرَمُ

data.price: 4. Who has taught (the writing) by the pen.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَ بِٱلۡقَلَمِ

data.price: 5. He has taught man that which he knew not.
data.arabic: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مَا لَمۡ يَعۡلَمۡ

data.price: 6. Nay! Verily, man does transgress (in disbelief and evil deed).
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَيَطۡغَىٰٓ

data.price: 7. Because he considers himself self-sufficient.
data.arabic: أَن رَّءَاهُ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰٓ

data.price: 8. Surely, unto your Lord is the return.
data.arabic: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلرُّجۡعَىٰٓ

data.price: 9. Have you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) seen him (i.e. Abû Jahl) who prevents
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي يَنۡهَىٰ

data.price: 10. A slave (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) when he prays?
data.arabic: عَبۡدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰٓ

data.price: 11. Tell me if he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is on the guidance (of Allâh)
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ

data.price: 12. Or enjoins piety!
data.arabic: أَوۡ أَمَرَ بِٱلتَّقۡوَىٰٓ

data.price: 13. Tell me if he (Abû Jahl) denies (the truth, i.e. this Qur’ân) and turns away?
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ

data.price: 14. Knows he not that Allâh does see (what he does)?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَعۡلَم بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرَىٰ

data.price: 15. Nay! If he (Abû Jahl) ceases not, We will catch him by the forelock -
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمۡ يَنتَهِ لَنَسۡفَعَۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ

data.price: 16. A lying, sinful forelock!
data.arabic: نَاصِيَةٖ كَٰذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٖ

data.price: 17. Then let him call upon his council (of helpers).
data.arabic: فَلۡيَدۡعُ نَادِيَهُۥ

data.price: 18. We will call out the guards of Hell (to deal with him)!
data.arabic: سَنَدۡعُ ٱلزَّبَانِيَةَ

data.price: 19. Nay! (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)! Do not obey him (Abû Jahl). Fall prostrate and draw near to Allâh!
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعۡهُ وَٱسۡجُدۡۤ وَٱقۡتَرِب۩

data.price: 1. Verily, We have sent it (this Qur’ân) down in the night of Al-Qadr (Decree).[1]
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنزَلۡنَٰهُ فِي لَيۡلَةِ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ
data.footnotes:
(V.97:1) "Therein (that night) is decreed every matter of ordainments." [The Qur’ân, (Verse 44:4)]**
** i.e., the matters of deaths, births, provisions, calamities for the whole (coming) year as decreed by Allâh.

data.price: 2. And what will make you know what the night of Al-Qadr (Decree) is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا لَيۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ

data.price: 3. The night of Al-Qadr (Decree) is better than a thousand months (i.e. worshipping Allâh in that night is better than worshipping Him a thousand months, i.e. 83 years and 4 months).
data.arabic: لَيۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أَلۡفِ شَهۡرٖ

data.price: 4. Therein descend the angels and the Rûh [Jibrîl (Gabrîl)] by Allâh’s Permission with all Decrees,
data.arabic: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذۡنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمۡرٖ

data.price: 5. (All that night), there is Peace (and Goodness from Allâh to His believing slaves) until the appearance of dawn.[2]
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطۡلَعِ ٱلۡفَجۡرِ
data.footnotes: (V.97:5) Narrated ‘Âishah رضي الله عنها: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Search for the Night of Qadr in the odd nights of the last ten nights of Ramadan." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 3, Hadith No.234).

data.price: 1. Those who disbelieve from among the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) and Al-Mushrikûn,[3] were not going to leave (their disbelief) until there came to them clear evidence.
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَكُنِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأۡتِيَهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَةُ
data.footnotes: (V.98:1) Al-Mushrikûn: polytheists, pagans, idolaters and disbelievers in the Oneness of Allâh and His Messenger Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم.

data.price: 2. A Messenger (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) from Allâh, reciting (the Qur’ân) purified pages [purified from Al-Bâtil (falsehood)].
data.arabic: رَسُولٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتۡلُواْ صُحُفٗا مُّطَهَّرَةٗ

data.price: 3. Wherein are correct and straight laws from Allâh.
data.arabic: فِيهَا كُتُبٞ قَيِّمَةٞ

data.price: 4. And the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) differed not until after there came to them clear evidence (i.e. Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم and whatever was revealed to him).
data.arabic: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَتۡهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَةُ

data.price: 5. And they were commanded not, but that they should worship Allâh, and worship none but Him Alone (abstaining from ascribing partners to Him), and perform As-Salât (Iqâmat-as-Salât) and give Zakât, and that is the right religion.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓاْ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مُخۡلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ حُنَفَآءَ وَيُقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤۡتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ ٱلۡقَيِّمَةِ

data.price: 6. Verily, those who disbelieve (in the religion of Islâm, the Qur’ân and Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) from among the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) and Al-Mushrikûn will abide in the Fire of Hell. They are the worst of creatures.[4]
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ شَرُّ ٱلۡبَرِيَّةِ
data.footnotes: (V.98:6) It is obligatory to have Belief in the Messengership of the Prophet (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم). Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "By Him (Allâh) in Whose Hand Muhammad’s soul is, there is none from amongst the Jews and Christians (of these present nations) who hears about me and then dies without believing in the Message with which I have been sent (i.e. Islâmic Monotheism) but he will be from the dwellers of the (Hell) Fire." (Sahih Muslim, the Book of Faith, Vol.1, Chapter No.240). See also (V.3:85) and (V.3:116).

data.price: 7. Verily, those who believe [in the Oneness of Allâh, and in His Messenger Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) including all obligations ordered by Islâm] and do righteous good deeds, they are the best of creatures.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡبَرِيَّةِ

data.price: 8. Their reward with their Lord is ‘Adn (Eden) Paradise (Gardens of Eternity), underneath which rivers flow. They will abide therein forever, Allâh will be pleased with them, and they with Him. That is for him who fears his Lord.
data.arabic: جَزَآؤُهُمۡ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّٰتُ عَدۡنٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدٗاۖ رَّضِيَ ٱللَّهُ عَنۡهُمۡ وَرَضُواْ عَنۡهُۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنۡ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُۥ

data.price: 1. When the earth is shaken with its (final) earthquake.
data.arabic: إِذَا زُلۡزِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ زِلۡزَالَهَا

data.price: 2. And when the earth throws out its burdens.
data.arabic: وَأَخۡرَجَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ أَثۡقَالَهَا

data.price: 3. And man will say: "What is the matter with it?"
data.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا لَهَا

data.price: 4. That Day it will declare its information (about all that happened over it of good or evil).
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُحَدِّثُ أَخۡبَارَهَا

data.price: 5. Because your Lord will inspire it.
data.arabic: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوۡحَىٰ لَهَا

data.price: 6. That Day mankind will proceed in scattered groups that they may be shown their deeds.[1]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَصۡدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشۡتَاتٗا لِّيُرَوۡاْ أَعۡمَٰلَهُمۡ
data.footnotes: (V.99:6) See footnote of (V.11:18).

data.price: 7. So whosoever does good equal to the weight of an atom (or a small ant) shall see it.
data.arabic: فَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيۡرٗا يَرَهُۥ

data.price: 8. And whosoever does evil equal to the weight of an atom (or a small ant) shall see it.
data.arabic: وَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٖ شَرّٗا يَرَهُۥ

data.price: 1. By the (steeds) that run, with panting.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡعَٰدِيَٰتِ ضَبۡحٗا

data.price: 2. Striking sparks of fire (by their hooves).
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُورِيَٰتِ قَدۡحٗا

data.price: 3. And scouring to the raid at dawn.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُغِيرَٰتِ صُبۡحٗا

data.price: 4. And raise the dust in clouds the while.
data.arabic: فَأَثَرۡنَ بِهِۦ نَقۡعٗا

data.price: 5. And penetrating forthwith as one into the midst (of the foe).
data.arabic: فَوَسَطۡنَ بِهِۦ جَمۡعًا

data.price: 6. Verily, man (disbeliever) is ungrateful to his Lord.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لِرَبِّهِۦ لَكَنُودٞ

data.price: 7. And to that he bears witness (by his deeds).
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٞ

data.price: 8. And verily, he is violent in the love of wealth.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لِحُبِّ ٱلۡخَيۡرِ لَشَدِيدٌ

data.price: 9. Knows he not that when the contents of the graves are poured forth (all mankind is resurrected)?
data.arabic: ۞ أَفَلَا يَعۡلَمُ إِذَا بُعۡثِرَ مَا فِي ٱلۡقُبُورِ

data.price: 10. And that which is in the breasts (of men) is made known?
data.arabic: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي ٱلصُّدُورِ

data.price: 11. Verily, that Day (i.e. the Day of Resurrection) their Lord will be Well-Acquainted with them (as to their deeds and will reward them for their deeds).
data.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّخَبِيرُۢ

data.price: 1. Al-Qâri‘ah (the striking Hour i.e. the Day of Resurrection).
data.arabic: ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: 2. What is the striking (Hour)?
data.arabic: مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: 3. And what will make you know what the striking (Hour) is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: 4. It is a Day whereon mankind will be like moths scattered about.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَكُونُ ٱلنَّاسُ كَٱلۡفَرَاشِ ٱلۡمَبۡثُوثِ

data.price: 5. And the mountains will be like carded wool.
data.arabic: وَتَكُونُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَٱلۡعِهۡنِ ٱلۡمَنفُوشِ

data.price: 6. Then as for him whose balance (of good deeds) will be heavy,[1]
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ
data.footnotes: (V.101:6) See footnote of (V.7:8).

data.price: 7. He will live a pleasant life (in Paradise).
data.arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٖ رَّاضِيَةٖ

data.price: 8. But as for him whose balance (of good deeds) will be light,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَفَّتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ

data.price: 9. He will have his home in Hâwiyah (pit, i.e. Hell).
data.arabic: فَأُمُّهُۥ هَاوِيَةٞ

data.price: 10. And what will make you know what it is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا هِيَهۡ

data.price: 11. (It is) a fiercely blazing Fire!
data.arabic: نَارٌ حَامِيَةُۢ

data.price: 1. The mutual rivalry (for piling up of worldly things) diverts you,
data.arabic: أَلۡهَىٰكُمُ ٱلتَّكَاثُرُ

data.price: 2. Until you visit the graves (i.e. till you die).
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰ زُرۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَقَابِرَ

data.price: 3. Nay! You shall come to know!
data.arabic: كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: 4. Again nay! You shall come to know!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: 5. Nay! If you knew with a sure knowledge (the end result of piling up, you would not have been occupied yourselves in worldly things).
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عِلۡمَ ٱلۡيَقِينِ

data.price: 6. Verily, You shall see the blazing Fire (Hell)!
data.arabic: لَتَرَوُنَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ

data.price: 7. And again, you shall see it with certainty of sight!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيۡنَ ٱلۡيَقِينِ

data.price: 8. Then on that Day you shall be asked about the delights[2] (you indulged in, in this world)!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَتُسۡـَٔلُنَّ يَوۡمَئِذٍ عَنِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
data.footnotes: (V.102:8) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Once during a day or a night Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم came out and found Abu Bakr and ‘Umar رضي الله عنهما: he said: "What has brought you out of your homes at this hour?" They replied: "Hunger, O Allâh’s Messenger." He said: "By Him (Allâh) in Whose Hand my soul is, I too have come out for the same reason for which you have come out". Then he صلى الله عليه وسلم said to them (both): "Come along! "And he went along with them to a man from the Ansâr but they did not find him in his house. The wife of that man saw the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم and said: "You are welcome." Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم asked her (saying): "Where is so-and-so?" She replied: "He has gone to fetch some water for us." In the mean time the Ansarî man came, saw Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم with his two Companions and said: "All the praise and thanks be to Allâh: today there is none superior to me as regards guests." Then he went and brought a part of a bunch of date-fruit, having dates, some still green, some ripe and some fully ripe and requested them to eat from it. He then took his knife (to slaughter for them a sheep). Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said to him: "Beware! Do not slaughter a milch sheep". So he slaughtered a sheep (prepared the meals from its meat). They ate from that sheep and that bunch of dates and drank water. After they had finished eating and drinking to their fill, Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said to Abu Bakr and ‘Umar رضي الله عنهما : "By Him in Whose Hand my soul is, you will be asked about this treat on the Day of Resurrection. He (Allâh) brought you out of your homes with hunger and you are not returning to your homes till you have been blessed with this treat." (Sahih Muslim, Vol.6, The Book of Drinks, Chapter 20, Pages 116,117).

data.price: 1. By Al-‘Asr (the time).
data.arabic: وَٱلۡعَصۡرِ

data.price: 2. Verily, man is in loss,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَفِي خُسۡرٍ

data.price: 3. Except those who believe (in Islâmic Monotheism) and do righteous good deeds, and recommend one another to the truth [i.e. order one another to perform all kinds of good deeds (Al-Ma‘ruf) which Allâh has ordained, and abstain from all kinds of sins and evil deeds (Al-Munkar which Allâh has forbidden], and recommend one another to patience (for the sufferings, harms, and injuries which one may encounter in Allâh’s Cause during preaching His religion of Islâmic Monotheism or Jihâd).
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ

data.price: 1. Woe to every slanderer and backbiter.[1]
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةٖ لُّمَزَةٍ
data.footnotes: (V.104:1) See the footnotes A, B, C, of (V.49:12).

data.price: 2. Who has gathered wealth and counted it.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي جَمَعَ مَالٗا وَعَدَّدَهُۥ

data.price: 3. He thinks that his wealth will make him last forever!
data.arabic: يَحۡسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُۥٓ أَخۡلَدَهُۥ

data.price: 4. Nay! Verily, he will be thrown into the crushing Fire.
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ لَيُنۢبَذَنَّ فِي ٱلۡحُطَمَةِ

data.price: 5. And what will make you know what the crushing Fire is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡحُطَمَةُ

data.price: 6. The fire of Allâh kindled,
data.arabic: نَارُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُوقَدَةُ

data.price: 7. Which leaps up over the hearts,
data.arabic: ٱلَّتِي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى ٱلۡأَفۡـِٔدَةِ

data.price: 8. Verily, it shall be closed upon them,
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا عَلَيۡهِم مُّؤۡصَدَةٞ

data.price: 9. In pillars stretched forth (i.e. they will be punished in the Fire with pillars).
data.arabic: فِي عَمَدٖ مُّمَدَّدَةِۭ

data.price: 1. Have you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) not seen how your Lord dealt with the owners of the Elephant? [The Elephant army which came from Yemen under the command of Abrahah Al-Ashram intending to destroy the Ka‘bah at Makkah].
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡفِيلِ

data.price: 2. Did He not make their plot go astray?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَجۡعَلۡ كَيۡدَهُمۡ فِي تَضۡلِيلٖ

data.price: 3. And He sent against them birds, in flocks,
data.arabic: وَأَرۡسَلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ طَيۡرًا أَبَابِيلَ

data.price: 4. Striking them with stones of Sijjîl (baked clay).
data.arabic: تَرۡمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٖ مِّن سِجِّيلٖ

data.price: 5. And He made them like (an empty field of) stalks (of which the corn has been eaten up by cattle).[2]
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُمۡ كَعَصۡفٖ مَّأۡكُولِۭ
data.footnotes: (V.105:5) The story of the army of the Elephants (the Qur’ân 105:1-5). This incident happened during the period of the birth-year of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم. Abrahah Al-Ashram was the governor of Yemen on behalf of the king of Ethiopia (as Yemen was a part of the Ethiopian kingdom). He (Abrahah) thought to build a house (like the Ka‘bah at Makkah) in San‘a (the capital of Yemen) and call the Arabs to perform the pilgrimage there in San‘a instead of the Ka‘bah (Al-Bait Al-Harâm) in Makkah, with the intention of diverting the trade and benefits from Makkah to Yemen. He presented his idea to the king of Ethiopia who agreed to his idea. So the house (church) was built and he named it Al-Qullais; there was no church of its like at that time. Then a man from the Quraish tribe of Makkah came there and was infuriated by it, so he relieved his nature (stools and urine) in it, soiled its walls and went away. When Abrahah Al-Ashram saw that, he could not control his anger and raised an army to invade Makkah and demolish the Ka‘bah. He had in that army thirteen elephants and amongst them was an elephant called Mahmûd which was the biggest of them. So that army proceeded and none amongst the Arab tribes that faced them (fought against them) but was killed and defeated, till it approached near Makkah. Then there took place negotiations between Abrahah Al-Ashram and the chief of Makkah (Abdul Muttalib bin Hâshim, the grandfather of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم), and it was concluded that Abrahah would restore the camels of Abdul Muttalib which he had taken away, and then he (Abrahah Al-Ashram) would decide himself as regards the Ka‘bah. Abdul Muttalib ordered the men of Makkah to evacuate the city and go to the top of the mountains along with their wives and children in case some harm should come to them from the invading oppressors. Then that army moved towards Makkah till they reached valley Muhassir. While the army was marching towards Makkah, in the middle of the valley, suddenly it was overtaken by flocks of birds, flocks after flocks, air-raiding that army with small stones slightly bigger than a lentil seed. There never fell a stone on a soldier except it dissolved his flesh and burst it into pieces. So they perished with a total destruction. Abrahah Al-Ashram fled away while his flesh was bursting into pieces till he died on the way (back to Yemen). Such was the victory bestowed by Allâh, (the All-Majestic, All-Powerful) to the people of Makkah and such was the protection provided by Him for His House (Ka‘bah in Makkah). (See Tafsîr Ibn Kathir, Sûrah Al-Fîl).

data.price: 1. (It is a great Grace from Allâh) for the protection of the Quraish,
data.arabic: لِإِيلَٰفِ قُرَيۡشٍ

data.price: 2. (And with all those Allâh’s Grace and Protections, We cause) the (Quraish) caravans to set forth safe in winter (to the south) and in summer (to the north without any fear),
data.arabic: إِۦلَٰفِهِمۡ رِحۡلَةَ ٱلشِّتَآءِ وَٱلصَّيۡفِ

data.price: 3. So let them worship (Allâh) the Lord of this House (the Ka‘bah in Makkah),
data.arabic: فَلۡيَعۡبُدُواْ رَبَّ هَٰذَا ٱلۡبَيۡتِ

data.price: 4. (He) Who has fed them against hunger, and has made them safe from fear.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٖ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ

data.price: 1. Have you seen him who denies the Recompense?
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِٱلدِّينِ

data.price: 2. That is he who repulses the orphan (harshly),[1]
data.arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ ٱلَّذِي يَدُعُّ ٱلۡيَتِيمَ
data.footnotes: (V.107:2) Narrated Sahl bin Sa‘d رضي الله عنهما : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "I and the person who looks after an orphan and provides for him, will be in Paradise like this," putting his index and middle fingers together. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.8, Hadith No.34).

data.price: 3. And urges not on the feeding of Al-Miskîn (the poor),[2]
data.arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ
data.footnotes: (V.107:3) Narrated Abû Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The one who looks after a widow or a poor person is like a Mujâhid (fighter) who fights for Allâh’s Cause, or like him who performs prayers all the night and fasts all the day." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.7, Hadith No.265).

data.price: 4. So woe unto those performers of Salât (prayers) (hypocrites),
data.arabic: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلۡمُصَلِّينَ

data.price: 5. Those who delay their Salât (prayer from their stated fixed times).
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَن صَلَاتِهِمۡ سَاهُونَ

data.price: 6. Those who do good deeds only to be seen (of men),
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ يُرَآءُونَ

data.price: 7. And prevent Al-Mâ‘ûn (small kindnesses like salt, sugar, water).
data.arabic: وَيَمۡنَعُونَ ٱلۡمَاعُونَ

data.price: 1. Verily, We have granted you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) Al-Kauthar (a river in Paradise).[3]
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعۡطَيۡنَٰكَ ٱلۡكَوۡثَرَ
data.footnotes: (V.108:1) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه: When the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم was made to ascend to the heavens. He صلى الله عليه وسلم said (after his return), "I came upon a river (in Paradise) the banks of which were made of tents of hollow pearls. I asked Jibrîl (Gabriel), ‘What is this (river)?’ He replied, ‘This is the Kauthar’ " (Sahih Al-Bukhâri, Vol.6, Hadîth No. 488).

data.price: 2. Therefore turn in prayer to your Lord and sacrifice (to Him only).
data.arabic: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَٱنۡحَرۡ

data.price: 3. For he who hates you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), he will be cut off (from posterity and every good thing in this world and in the Hereafter).[4]
data.arabic: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ ٱلۡأَبۡتَرُ
data.footnotes: (V.108:3) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "None of you will have Faith till he loves me more than his father, his children and all mankind. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadith No.14).

data.price: 1. Say: (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم to these Mushrikûn and Kâfirûn): "O Al-Kafirûn (disbelievers in Allâh, in His Oneness, in His Angels, in His Books, in His Messengers, in the Day of Resurrection, and in Al-Qadar)!
data.arabic: قُلۡ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ

data.price: 2. "I worship not that which you worship,
data.arabic: لَآ أَعۡبُدُ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: 3. "Nor will you worship that which I worship.
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنتُمۡ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعۡبُدُ

data.price: 4. "And I shall not worship that which you are worshipping.
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنَا۠ عَابِدٞ مَّا عَبَدتُّمۡ

data.price: 5. "Nor will you worship that which I worship.
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنتُمۡ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعۡبُدُ

data.price: 6. "To you be your religion, and to me my religion (Islâmic Monotheism)."
data.arabic: لَكُمۡ دِينُكُمۡ وَلِيَ دِينِ

data.price: 1. When there comes the Help of Allâh (to you, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم against your enemies) and the conquest (of Makkah).
data.arabic: إِذَا جَآءَ نَصۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡفَتۡحُ

data.price: 2. And you see that the people enter Allah’s religion (Islâm) in crowds.
data.arabic: وَرَأَيۡتَ ٱلنَّاسَ يَدۡخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ ٱللَّهِ أَفۡوَاجٗا

data.price: 3. So glorify the Praises of your Lord, and ask His Forgiveness. Verily, He is the One Who accepts the repentance and Who forgives.
data.arabic: فَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرۡهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابَۢا

data.price: 1. Perish the two hands of Abû Lahab (an uncle of the Prophet) and perish he![1]
data.arabic: تَبَّتۡ يَدَآ أَبِي لَهَبٖ وَتَبَّ
data.footnotes:
(V.111:1) Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما : "When the Verse, ‘And warn your tribe (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) of near kindred.’ (V.26:214) was revealed, Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم went out, and when he had ascended As-Safâ mountain, he shouted, ‘Yâ Sabâhâh !’* The people said, ‘What is that?’ Then they gathered around him, whereupon he said, ‘Do you see? If I inform you that cavalrymen are proceeding up the side of this mountain, will you believe me?’ They said, ‘We have never heard you telling a lie.’ Then he said, ‘I am a plain warner to you of a coming severe punishment.’ Abû Lahab said, ‘May you perish! You gathered us only for this reason?’ Then Abu Lahab went away. So [Sûrat Al-Masad] ‘Perish the hands of Abu Lahab!’ was revealed. (V.111:1). (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 6, Hadith No.495).
* "Yâ Sabâhâh!" is an Arabic expression used when one appeals for help or draws the attention of others to some danger.

data.price: 2. His wealth and his children will not benefit him!
data.arabic: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ

data.price: 3. He will be burnt in a Fire of blazing flames!
data.arabic: سَيَصۡلَىٰ نَارٗا ذَاتَ لَهَبٖ

data.price: 4. And his wife, too, who carries wood (thorns of Sa‘dân which she used to put on the way of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم, or use to slander him).[2]
data.arabic: وَٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ حَمَّالَةَ ٱلۡحَطَبِ
data.footnotes: (V.111:4) ‘And his wife too, who carries wood.’ Mujâhid said, ‘Carries the wood’ means that she used to slander (the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم) and goes about with calumnies.

data.price: 5. In her neck is a twisted rope of Masad (palm fibre).[3]
data.arabic: فِي جِيدِهَا حَبۡلٞ مِّن مَّسَدِۭ
data.footnotes:
(V.111:5) "In her neck is a twisted rope of palm fibre, [i.e. the chain which is in the Fire (of Hell)]." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 6, Chapter 356, Page 469).
[Imâm Qurtubî says in the Tafsîr of the (V.17:45)]:
Narrated Sa‘îd bin Jubâir رضي الله عنه : "When Sûrah No.111 Al-Masad was revealed, the wife of Abu Lahab came looking out for the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم while Abu Bakr رضي الله عنه was sitting beside him. Abu Bakr said to the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم : ‘I wish if you get aside (or go away) as she is coming, to us, she may harm you’. The Prophet said: ‘There will be a screen set between me and her’. So she did not see him صلى الله عليه وسلم. She said to Abu Bakr: ‘Your companion is saying poetry against me.’ Abu Bakr said: ‘By Allâh he does not say poetry.’ She said: ‘Do you believe that’. Then she left. Abu Bakr said, ‘O Allâh’s Messenger! She did not see you’. The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said: ‘An angel was screening me from her.’" [This Hadith is quoted in Musnad Abû Ya‘lâ]
It is said that if the Verse [(17: 45) The Qur’an] is recited by a real believer (of Islâmic Monotheism) he will be screened from a disbeliever. (Allâh knows best). (Tafsîr Al-Qurtubî, Vol.10, Page 269).

data.price: 1. Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "He is Allâh, (the) One.[1]
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
data.footnotes: (V.112:1) See Tauhîd in the Glossary (Appendix).

data.price: 2. "Allâh-us-Samad (السيد الذي يصمد إليه في الحاجات) [Allâh the Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, (He neither eats nor drinks)].
data.arabic: ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ

data.price: 3. "He begets not, nor was He begotten.[2]
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَلِدۡ وَلَمۡ يُولَدۡ
data.footnotes:
(V.112:3)
A) Narrated Mu‘âdh bin Jabal رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "O Mu‘âdh! Do you know what Allâh’s Right upon His slaves is?" I said, "Allâh and His Messenger know better." The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "To worship Him (Allâh) Alone and to join none in worship with Him (Allâh). Do you know what their right upon Him is?" I replied, "Allâh and His Messenger know better." The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Not to punish them (if they did so)." [Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.9, Hadith No.470].
B) Narrated Abu Sa‘îd Al-Khudrî رضي الله عنه: A man heard another man reciting: ‘Say (O Muhammad): "He is Allâh, (the) One." (112:1) And he recited it repeatedly. When it was morning, he went to the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم and informed him about that as if he considered that the recitation of that Sûrah by itself was not enough. Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "By Him in Whose Hand my soul is, it is equal to one-third of the Our’ân." [Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.9, Hadith No.471].
C) Narrated ‘Âishah رضي الله عنها: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم sent (an army unit) under the command of a man who used to lead his companions in the prayers and would finish his recitation with (the Sûrah 112): ‘Say (O Muhammad): "He is Allâh, (the) One.’" (112:1). When they returned (from the battle), they mentioned that to the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم. He said (to them), "Ask him why he does so." They asked him and he said, "I do so because it mentions the Qualities of the Most Gracious and I love to recite it (in my prayer)." The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said (to them). "Tell him that Allâh loves him." [Sahih Al Bukhari, Vol.9, Hadith No. 472].

data.price: 4. "And there is none co-equal or comparable unto Him."
data.arabic: وَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدُۢ

data.price: 1. Say: "I seek refuge with (Allâh), the Lord of the daybreak,
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡفَلَقِ

data.price: 2. "From the evil of what He has created,
data.arabic: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ

data.price: 3. "And from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness; (or the moon as it sets or goes away),
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ

data.price: 4. "And from the evil of those who practise witchcraft when they blow in the knots,
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّٰثَٰتِ فِي ٱلۡعُقَدِ

data.price: 5. "And from the evil of the envier when he envies."
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ

data.price: 1. Say: "I seek refuge with (Allâh) the Lord of mankind,[3]
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ
data.footnotes: (V.114:1) Narrated ‘Âishah رضي الله عنها: whenever Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم went to bed, he used to recite Sûrat Al-Ikhlâs (112), Sûrat Al-Falaq (113) and Sûrat An-Nâs (114) and then blow on his palms and pass them over his face and those parts of his body that his hands could reach. And when he fell ill, he used to order me to do like that for him. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.7, Hadith No.644).

data.price: 2. "The King of mankind -[4]
data.arabic: مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ
data.footnotes: (V.114:2) The Statement of Allâh عز وجل: ‘The King of mankind.’ Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "On the Day of Resurrection Allâh will grasp the whole (planet of) earth (by His Hand) and shall roll up the heaven with His Right Hand and say, ‘I am the King. Where are the kings of the earth?’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.9, Hadith No.479).

data.price: 3. "The Ilâh (God) of mankind,
data.arabic: إِلَٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: 4. "From the evil of the whisperer (devil who whispers evil in the hearts of men) who withdraws (from his whispering in one’s heart after one remembers Allâh).[5]
data.arabic: مِن شَرِّ ٱلۡوَسۡوَاسِ ٱلۡخَنَّاسِ
data.footnotes:
(V.114:4) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The (Hell) Fire is surrounded by all kinds of desires and passions, while Paradise is surrounded by all kinds of disliked undesirable things."* (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 8, Hadith No.494).
* Inordinate desires and animalistic passions lead to the Fire while self-control, perseverance, chastity and all other virtues, and the obedience to Allâh and His Messengerصلى الله عليه وسلم lead to Paradise. What leads to Hell is easy to do while what leads to Paradise is difficult to do.

data.price: 5. "Who whispers in the breasts of mankind.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يُوَسۡوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: 6. "Of jinn and men."
data.arabic: مِنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ

chapters: She that is to be Examined
